longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for a system of registration of title to land, and to provide for matters incidental thereto or connected therewith.

editorialNote.content: Amendments by E.R. 5 of 2021 and E.R. 6 of 2021 will be incorporated in the Ordinance upon its commencement.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Land Titles Ordinance.
This Ordinance shall come into operation on a day to be appointed by the Secretary for Development by notice published in the Gazette. (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: “applications register” (申請註冊紀錄) means the applications register kept under section 5;
“authorized land surveyor” (認可土地測量師) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Land Survey Ordinance (Cap. 473);

def.name: Charge
def.leadIn: “charge” (押記) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a legal charge within the meaning of section 2 of the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a mortgage of an equitable interest over land but excluding any mortgage of an interest which is only capable of being protected by a consent caution or non-consent caution;

subsection.def: “chargee” (承押記人) means the owner of a charge;

“charging order” (押記令) means an order of any court of competent jurisdiction imposing on registered land, or a registered long term lease, specified in the order a charge for securing the payment of any money due or to become due under a judgment or order of the court;

def.name: Company
def.leadIn: “company” (公司) means a body corporate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: incorporated under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: incorporated under a former Companies Ordinance as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Added 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: incorporated under any other enactment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: incorporated or established outside Hong Kong,

def.continued: and includes an unregistered company within the meaning of Part X of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.def: “consent caution” (同意警告書) means a caution referred to in section 71(1) and (3);
“Court” (法庭) means the Court of First Instance;
“current” (當時有效), in relation to any matter, means the matter has not ceased to have effect;

def.name: DateOfFirstRegistration
def.leadIn: “date of first registration” (首次註冊日期) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to registered land, the date determined in accordance with section 22 of this Ordinance or section 3 of Schedule 1, whichever is applicable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a registered long term lease, the date determined in accordance with section 49(5) of this Ordinance or section 6 of Schedule 1, whichever is applicable;

subsection.def: “dealing” (交易) means a disposition or transmission;

def.name: Disposition
def.leadIn: “disposition” (處置) means an act by the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, whereby his rights in or over the land, charge or lease, as the case may be, are affected, but does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an agreement to transfer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an agreement to charge;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an agreement to grant a long term lease; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an agreement to grant an easement,

def.continued: and “dispose”, “disposal” and “disposed” (處置) shall be construed accordingly;

def.name: Document
def.leadIn: “document” (文件) includes, in addition to a document in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a map, plan or drawing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a disc, tape or other device in which data other than visual images are embodied so as to be capable, with or without the aid of some other equipment, of being reproduced from the disc, tape or other device; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a film, tape or other device in which visual images are embodied so as to be capable, with or without the aid of some other equipment, of being reproduced from the film, tape or other device;

subsection.def: “fraud” (欺詐) includes dishonesty and forgery;

“imaging method” (影像處理方法) means a method by which documents in a legible form or in the form of microfilm are scanned by a scanner and the information recorded therein is converted into electronic images, which are then stored on electronic storage media capable of being retrieved and reproduced in a legible form;
“inhibition” (制止令) means an order made under section 75(1);

def.name: Instrument
def.leadIn: “instrument” (文書) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a deed, conveyance, judgment, decree, order or other document which is—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: specified in any other enactment as a document which shall or may support an application for registration under this Ordinance (or words to the like effect); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a memorial which supports a current entry in the Title Register,

def.continued: but does not include a will except a will which is the subject of a memorial referred to in paragraph (b);

def.name: Land
def.leadIn: “land” (土地) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: land covered by water; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a thing attached to land or permanently fastened to a thing attached to land,

def.continued: but does not include an interest in or over land other than—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an undivided share in land; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such an interest vested in a person by virtue of the operation of section 23, 25(1) or 26(1) of this Ordinance or section 4 or 7 of Schedule 1;

subsection.def: “land boundary plan” (土地界線圖) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Land Survey Ordinance (Cap. 473);
“Land Registry” (土地註冊處) means the Land Registry of the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region which is administered by the Registrar;
“Land Titles Indemnity Fund” (土地業權彌償基金) means the indemnity fund established pursuant to section 90;

def.name: Lessee
def.leadIn: “lessee” (承租人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a registered long term lease, the person named in the Title Register as the lessee of the lease; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any other lease, the lessee of the lease;

subsection.def: “liquidator” (清盤人) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

def.name: LisPendens
def.leadIn: “lis pendens” (待決案件) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any action or proceeding pending in any court or tribunal that relates to land or any interest in or charge on land; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a bankruptcy petition;

def.name: LongTermLease
def.leadIn: “long term lease” (長期租契) means a lease—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: granted by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), the owner of registered land;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the lease was granted before the land became registered land under this Ordinance, the owner of the land at the time of the grant,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not at rack rent; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in respect of which a premium has been paid,

subsection.def: “lot” (地段) includes a section and subsection of a lot;

def.name: LotNumber
def.leadIn: “lot number” (地段編號) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a lot, the designation and number by which the lot is described in the Government lease under which it is held from the Government; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a section or subsection of a lot, the designation and number by which the section or subsection, as the case may be, is described in the instrument by which it came into existence as such;

subsection.def: “matter” (事項) means the subject of any application delivered for registration;
“memorial” (註冊摘要) means a memorial registered under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128);
“mortgage” (按揭) means a security over land for securing money or money’s worth;
“non-consent caution” (非同意警告書) means a caution referred to in section 71(4), (6) and (13);
“overriding interest” (凌駕性權益) means an interest referred to in section 28(1);

def.name: Owner
def.leadIn: “owner” (擁有人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to registered land, the person (including, in respect of registered land to which Part II of the New Territories Ordinance (Cap. 97) applies, any clan, family or t’ong) named in the Title Register as—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the owner, lessee or holder (or words to the like effect) of a Government lease of the land; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b

def.name: PersonalRepresentative
def.leadIn: “personal representative” (遺產代理人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the executor of the will; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the administrator of the estate,

def.continued: of the deceased owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the deceased lessee of a registered long term lease;

subsection.def: “present” (呈遞) includes produce, deliver and lodge;

“register” (註冊), when used as a verb, means to make, remove, alter or add to an entry in the Title Register, but does not include to make, remove, alter or add to an entry in the Title Register to the extent that the entry denotes, in the case of the presentation of an application for the registration of a matter, that registration is pending or withheld in respect of the matter; and “registered” (註冊), “unregistered” (未經註冊) and “registration” (註冊) shall be construed accordingly;
“registered charge” (註冊押記) means a charge registered in respect of registered land or a registered long term lease under section 37;

def.name: RegisteredLand
def.leadIn: “registered land” (註冊土地) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: land—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: held under a Government lease; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the title to which is registered under section 21; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: land deemed to be registered land under section 2 of Schedule 1;

def.name: RegisteredLongTermLease
def.leadIn: “registered long term lease” (註冊長期租契) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a long term lease registered under section 49; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: “registered matter” (註冊事項) does not include any matter which has ceased to have any effect;
“Registrar” (處長) means the Land Registrar;
“regulations” (《規例》) means regulations made under this Ordinance;
“remove” (刪除), in relation to an entry in the Title Register, includes to delete by any means which, in the opinion of the Registrar, is appropriate in respect of that entry;
“restriction” (限制令) means an order made under section 78(1);
“search” (查冊) means a search under section 30(1);
“Secretary” (局長) means the Secretary for Development; (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)
“specified” (指明), in relation to a form, means specified under section 99;
“title certificate” (業權證明書) means a certificate issued under section 29(1);

“transfer” (轉移) means the registration of a matter to effect the passing of the title to registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease from one person to another person otherwise than by operation of law, and includes the instrument providing for such passing;

“transmission” (傳轉) means the passing of the title to registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease from one person to another person under an order of a court of competent jurisdiction, under an enactment or by operation of law;
“trustee” (受託人) includes a personal representative;
“unregistrable interest” (不可註冊權益) has the meaning assigned to it by section 1A(1) of the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128);
“valuable consideration” (有值代價) means money or money’s worth, but does not include a nominal consideration.

subsection.leadIn: It is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the title to land becomes registered under this Ordinance by virtue of an entry being made in the Title Register specifying a person as being the owner of that land, and references in this Ordinance to registered land shall be construed accordingly; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any reference in any other enactment to “register in the Land Registry” or “registered in the Land Registry”, or words to the like effect, shall be construed to mean register or registered under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128) or this Ordinance, as the case may require.

subsection.content: Subject to Part 4 and Schedule 1, this Ordinance applies to land held under a Government lease.

Where land is vested in a person under the provisions of any other enactment and there is any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Ordinance and the provisions of that enactment in relation to that land, then the provisions of that enactment shall, in relation to that land and to the extent of that conflict or inconsistency, as the case may be, prevail over the provisions of this Ordinance.

Where an instrument supporting an application for registration of a transfer under this Ordinance is void under the provisions of any other enactment governing the validity of a transfer, then the provisions of that enactment shall, in relation to the land to which the transfer relates, prevail over the provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any provisions of any other enactment purport to provide that any legal or equitable interest in land or in a charge shall not be created, extinguished, transferred, varied or affected (or words to the like effect) except by an instrument (howsoever described) referred to in those provisions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by virtue of the provisions of this Ordinance, such interest may only be created, extinguished, transferred, varied or affected, as the case may be, by the registration under this Ordinance of an application providing therefor,

subsection.continued: then—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: without prejudice to any other ground on which the instrument may be void or voidable and notwithstanding any law, that instrument shall not be void or voidable on the ground that it does not, of itself, create, extinguish, transfer, vary or affect, as the case may be, such interest;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the provisions referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b) shall be construed to require that instrument to accompany that application; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: any reference to the instrument in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any other provisions of that enactment;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any provisions of any other enactment; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any other provisions of this Ordinance,

paragraph.continued: shall, without prejudice to the operation of section 2A of the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117), be construed to take account of the operation of this subsection.

subsection.content: The Registrar shall keep in the Land Registry a register to be known as the Title Register.

subsection.leadIn: There shall be entered in the Title Register such matters as are or may be required to be entered therein under this Ordinance or any other enactment including, but not limited to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: particulars of the land the title to which is registered under this Ordinance, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its title number (which may include letters or alphanumeric symbols or characters);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the lot number of the land;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the undivided shares, if any, in the land;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the location or address, if any, of the land;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the date of commencement of the term of the Government lease and its expiry date;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the name of the owner or owners of the land; and

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: the capacity in which the owner or owners hold the land, whether as sole owner, tenants in common, joint tenants, trustee or otherwise;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: particulars of each long term lease registered under this Ordinance, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its title number (which may include letters or alphanumeric symbols or characters);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the lot number of the land;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the undivided shares, if any, in the land;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the location or address, if any, of the land;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the term of the lease;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the name of the lessee or lessees of the lease; and

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: the capacity in which the lessee or lessees hold the lease, whether as sole lessee, tenants in common, joint tenants, trustee or otherwise;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: particulars of each charge registered under this Ordinance, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its application number (which may include letters or alphanumeric symbols or characters); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name of the chargor;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: particulars of all instruments which support a current entry in the Title Register;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the date of registration of each of the instruments referred to in paragraph (d);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: particulars of any pending application for the registration of any matter under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: such other matters as the Registrar is of the opinion should be contained in the Title Register.

subsection.content: The Registrar shall keep in the Land Registry a register to be known as the applications register, which shall contain a record of all pending applications for the registration of any matter under this Ordinance.
The applications register shall contain such particulars as are required by the regulations to be contained therein.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall keep in the Land Registry, or make and keep in the Land Registry a microfilm, image record or other record (including an image record of a microfilm) of, the following documents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any memorial which supports a current entry in the Title Register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the documents, if any, accompanying a memorial referred to in paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any application for the registration of a matter where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the matter has been registered; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the application supports a current entry in the Title Register;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the documents, if any, accompanying an application referred to in paragraph (c).

subsection.leadIn: Where a microfilm, image record or other record of a document is made under subsection (1), the Registrar may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: destroy or otherwise dispose of the document from which the record was made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: return that document to the person by whom, or on whose behalf, it was delivered to the Land Registry.

subsection.content: Where a microfilm, image record or other record is made of a document under subsection (1), the microfilm, image record or other record, as the case may be, shall be treated for all purposes as the original document.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Form of registers
section.text: The Title Register and the applications register may be kept in such form as the Registrar considers appropriate, including in a form other than a documentary form.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be responsible for the general administration of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to the regulations, be responsible for the general management and administration of the Land Titles Indemnity Fund;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: supervise compliance with the provisions of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: perform such other functions and exercise such other powers as are imposed or conferred on him under this Ordinance or any other enactment.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may do all such things as are necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the better performance of his functions and exercise of his powers, and in particular but without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require a person to present to him any document relating to registered land or a registered long term lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: require a person to appear before him and give any information or explanation in respect of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any matter relating to registered land or a registered long term lease; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any document relating to registered land or a registered long term lease;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require a person to verify, on oath or by statutory declaration, any proceedings, information or explanation affecting registration and, for that purpose, administer the oath or take the declaration;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: refuse to proceed with the registration of a matter if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any document, or any information or explanation, required to be presented or given is withheld;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any act required to be performed under this Ordinance is not performed;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: without prejudice to the generality of subparagraph (ii), any fee payable in respect of the registration (including any additional fee payable under section 33) has not been paid; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the provisions of this Ordinance or of any other enactment relating to the registration of the matter have not been complied with;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: where he is of the view that a matter is not registrable, refuse to register the matter; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), order that the costs, charges and expenses incurred by him or another person in connection with an inquiry, investigation or hearing held by the Registrar for the purposes of this Ordinance shall be borne and paid by such persons and in such proportions as the Registrar thinks fit.

subsection.content: The Registrar shall not make an order under subsection (2)(f) except after giving the persons to be affected by the order, and such other interested persons as the Registrar thinks fit, an opportunity of being heard.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Registrar may apply to Court for directions
section.text: If any question of law arises in respect of the performance or exercise of any functions or powers imposed or conferred on the Registrar by or under this Ordinance, the Registrar may apply to the Court for directions.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Registrar may, with or without restrictions as he thinks fit, delegate in writing any of his functions or powers under this Ordinance to any public officer.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall not delegate any of his functions and powers under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any provisions of this Ordinance specified in Schedule 2; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any provisions of any regulations made under this Ordinance which are specified in the regulations as provisions which shall not be subject to subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: A delegate of the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall perform the delegated functions and may exercise the delegated powers as if the delegate were the Registrar himself; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be presumed to be acting in accordance with the terms of the delegation in the absence of evidence to the contrary.

subsection.content: No person to whom this subsection applies, acting in good faith, shall be personally liable in damages for any act done or default made in the performance or purported performance of any function, or the exercise or purported exercise of any power, under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Government shall not be liable in damages for either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any act or default referred to in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any other act done or default made—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by a person, to whom that subsection applies, not acting in good faith; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the performance or purported performance of any function, or the exercise or purported exercise of any power, under this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: unless that act or default gives rise to an indemnity under Part 12 and, in any such case, the liability shall not exceed the amount of the indemnity provided under that Part in respect of that act or default.

subsection.leadIn: The persons to whom subsection (1) applies are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar (including a delegate of the Registrar under section 10); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any public officer assisting the Registrar (or any such delegate) in the performance or purported performance of any function, or the exercise or purported exercise of any power, under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Land Registry shall have a seal of office having inscribed in the margin of the seal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words “Land Registrar, Hong Kong Special Administrative Region” in the English language and “香港特別行政區土地註冊處處長” in the Chinese language; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other words as the Registrar may from time to time specify by notice published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of any proceedings, whether under this Ordinance or otherwise, an instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: purporting to bear the imprint of the seal referred to in subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: purporting to be signed and issued by a person referred to in section 11(3),

subsection.continued: shall be received in evidence in those proceedings upon its production without further proof and, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, it shall be presumed—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the instrument purports to be so signed, that the signature is that of the person referred to in that section; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where the instrument purports to be so issued, that it was issued by or under the direction of the Registrar.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Matters capable of being registered
section.leadIn: No matter shall be capable of being registered in the Title Register unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration of the matter is expressly provided for in this Ordinance or any other enactment (by whatever words used);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where paragraph (a) is not applicable, the matter is a dealing in registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where neither paragraph (a) nor (b) is applicable, the matter is an order of any court or tribunal—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: affecting registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: issued or made for the purpose of enforcing a judgment; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in any other case, the matter affects registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease and the Registrar permits it to be registered.

subsection.leadIn: Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Ordinance, no matter shall be registered in the Title Register unless the matter is the subject of an application presented to the Registrar for the registration of that matter, and this requirement applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not any express reference is made in this Ordinance to that matter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an express reference is made in this Ordinance to the registration of that matter, whether or not that reference is accompanied by an express reference to such an application.

subsection.content: Each application for the registration of any matter shall be verified in such manner as is required by the regulations.

subsection.leadIn: Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Ordinance, the registration of any matter in the Title Register shall be effected by the Registrar in the following manner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by making, or adding to, an entry in the Title Register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by removing or altering an entry in the Title Register; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by any combination of the acts mentioned in paragraphs (a) and (b).

subsection.content: The registration of a matter in the Title Register is effected when that matter is registered by virtue of the making, the addition to, or the removal or alteration of, an entry in the Title Register which refers to that matter, the application for registration of that matter or any document accompanying that application, or any combination thereof, and references in this Ordinance to the registration of any matter (howsoever expressed) shall be construed accordingly.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Entry in Title Register constitutes notice to all persons
section.text: All persons are deemed to have notice of every entry in the Title Register.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Removal of obsolete entries
section.text: The Registrar may remove any entry in the Title Register which has ceased to have any effect.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a plan referred to in the Title Register, or a plan or microfilm, image record or other record of a plan kept in the Land Registry under section 6, shall be treated as only indicating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the approximate situation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approximate boundaries,

subsection.continued: of the registered land to which the plan relates.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the fact that a plan is referred to in the Title Register, or the fact that a plan or microfilm, image record or other record of a plan is kept in the Land Registry under section 6, shall not constitute a warranty, or a guarantee, as to the accuracy of the plan.

Where the Registrar is presented with an application from the owner of contiguous parcels of registered land for the combination of that land, the Registrar may effect the combination by making the appropriate entries in the Title Register to create a single title for the combined parcels of registered land.

Where any new building is or is to be situated on any land consisting of 2 or more lots (and whether or not the owner or owners of the respective lots is or are the same person or persons), then the Registrar shall, in the circumstances prescribed by the regulations, refuse to proceed with the registration of any matter relating to an undivided share with an exclusive right to use and occupy a part of the building unless and until an application for the combination of those lots has been registered.

Subject to section 44, where the Registrar is presented with an application from the owner of registered land for the division of the land, the Registrar may, if he considers it expedient to do so, effect the division by making the appropriate entries in the Title Register to create a single title for each parcel of land into which the registered land is to be divided.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 44, where the Registrar is presented with an application for the division of registered land by a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to be the purchaser of one or more of the parcels of land to result from the division; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has the consent of the owner of the land to make the application,

subsection.continued: the Registrar may, if he considers it expedient to do so, effect the division upon the registration of that application, by making the appropriate entries in the Title Register to create a single title for each parcel of land into which the registered land is to be divided.

def.name: NewBuilding
def.leadIn: In this section, “new building” (新建築物) means a building in respect of which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an occupation permit may be issued under section 21 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) on or after the appointed day;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a temporary occupation permit may be issued under section 21 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) on or after the appointed day in respect of the whole or any part of the building;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a certificate of exemption has been issued under the Buildings Ordinance (Application to the New Territories) Ordinance (Cap. 121) before the appointed day but the building has not been completed before that day; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a certificate of exemption under the Buildings Ordinance (Application to the New Territories) Ordinance (Cap. 121) may be issued on or after the appointed day.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (1) shall not of itself operate to authorize the amalgamation or unification of Government leases of contiguous parcels of registered land which have been combined under that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: this section shall not authorize anything to be done which would be inconsistent with the other provisions of this Ordinance or of any other enactment.

part.name: P4
part.heading: REGISTRATION OF TITLE TO LAND AND CONNECTED MATTERS

section.name: s20
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 4
section.leadIn: “LRO land” (《土註條例》土地) has the meaning assigned to it by section 1 of Schedule 1;

def.name: NewLand
def.leadIn: “new land” (新土地) means land granted under a Government lease or an agreement for a Government lease on or after the appointed day but does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: land granted under a short term tenancy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: land which was the subject of a Government lease or agreement for a Government lease in effect immediately before the appointed day and which is the subject of an instrument executed on or after the appointed day whereby—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the term of the Government lease or agreement for a Government lease has been extended;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the area of the land has been extended; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the provisions of the Government lease or agreement for a Government lease have otherwise been varied;

section.def: “short term tenancy” (短期租約) means a lease expressed to be granted for a term of not more than 7 years; and in calculating that period for the purpose of this definition there shall be excluded any extension or renewal of the lease that has occurred, or may occur, by virtue of the exercise of any right.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Registration of title to new land
section.leadIn: On the presentation of an application by the Director of Lands, the Registrar shall register the title to new land by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making an entry in the Title Register to the effect that the Government lessee is the owner of the land; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: entering such other particulars in the Title Register relating to the land as the Registrar considers appropriate.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Date of first registration of new land
section.text: The date of first registration of new land to which the title is registered under section 21 shall be the day on which the Registrar makes the entries in the Title Register referred to in that section.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Effect of first registration of new land
section.text: On the date of first registration of new land, the registration of any person as the owner of the land shall vest in that person the same legal estate or equitable interest and rights as would be vested in that person if the land were transferred to him and he was registered as the owner of land under section 25.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Registration of LRO land
section.text: LRO land shall become registered land as provided in Schedule 1.

part.name: P5
part.heading: EFFECT OF REGISTRATION AND CONNECTED MATTERS

section.name: s25
section.heading: Effect of registration of transfer of land

subsection.content: Subject to sections 27 and 82, the registration of a person as the owner upon a transfer of land shall vest in the person who is registered as the owner of the land the legal estate or equitable interest and rights described in subsection (2), free from all other interests and claims except as specified in subsection (3).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Where paragraph (a)(i) of the definition of “owner” in section 2(1) is applicable and the land is held under a Government lease or an agreement for a Government lease in respect of which a Government lease is deemed to have been issued under section 14 of the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219), there shall vest in the person who is registered as the owner—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the legal estate in the land held under the Government lease or the agreement for the Government lease (but excluding any case where the person does not hold the full unexpired term of the lease of the land); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: all rights attaching to the land which may be exercised by virtue of that legal estate.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Where paragraph (a)(i) of the definition of “owner” in section 2(1) is applicable and the land is held under an agreement for a Government lease in respect of which any condition precedent has not been complied with or has not been deemed to have been complied with under section 14 of the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219), there shall vest in the person who is registered as the owner—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the equitable interest in the land held under that agreement (but excluding any case where the person does not hold the full unexpired term of the agreement for lease); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: all rights attaching to the land which may be exercised by virtue of that equitable interest.

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Where paragraph (a)(ii) of the definition of “owner” in section 2(1) is applicable and the land is held under a Government lease or an agreement for a Government lease in respect of which a Government lease is deemed to have been issued under section 14 of the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219), there shall vest in the person who is registered as the owner—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the legal estate of the undivided share in the land (but excluding any case where the person does not hold the full unexpired term of the lease of the land); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: all rights attaching to the land which may be exercised by virtue of that legal estate.

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Where paragraph (a)(ii) of the definition of “owner” in section 2(1) is applicable and the land is held under an agreement for a Government lease in respect of which any condition precedent has not been complied with or has not been deemed to have been complied with under section 14 of the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219), there shall vest in the person who is registered as the owner—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the equitable interest of the undivided share in the land (but excluding any case where the person does not hold the full unexpired term of the lease of the land); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: all rights attaching to the land which may be exercised by virtue of that equitable interest.

subsection.leadIn: The person who is registered as the owner shall hold his legal estate or equitable interest and rights subject to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any covenants, exceptions, reservations, stipulations, provisos or declarations contained in the Government lease or the agreement for a Government lease of the land;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any registered matter affecting the land; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any overriding interest affecting the land.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall relieve the owner of registered land from a duty to which he is subject as trustee.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Effect of registration of long term lease

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3) and sections 27 and 82, immediately upon registration of a person as the lessee of a registered long term lease, there shall vest in the person, free from all other interests and claims—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the interest in the lease; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all rights attaching to the land which may be exercised by virtue of that interest.

subsection.leadIn: The person who is registered as the lessee shall hold his interest and rights subject to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any covenants, exceptions, reservations, stipulations, provisos or declarations contained in the Government lease of the land or the long term lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any registered matter affecting the land; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any overriding interest affecting the land.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall relieve the lessee of a registered long term lease from a duty to which he is subject as trustee.

Subject to subsection (2), the provisions of this Ordinance shall operate in relation to the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, who has acquired the land, charge or lease by transfer without valuable consideration as if the transfer had been for valuable consideration.

subsection.leadIn: The owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, referred to in subsection (1) shall hold the land, charge or lease subject to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provisions of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Part V of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 33(9) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any unregistered interests (including any matter referred to in section 4(2) or 7(2) of Schedule 1) subject to which the immediately preceding transferor held the land, charge or lease.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) shall not operate to limit, restrict, or qualify the operation of any other provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: All registered land shall be subject to such of the following interests as affect the land notwithstanding that the interests are not the subject of an entry in the Title Register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if Part II of the New Territories Ordinance (Cap. 97) applies to the land, any Chinese custom or customary right affecting the land;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any public rights;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: easements provided for in any instrument within the meaning of the Land Registration Regulations (Cap. 128 sub. leg. A) in respect of which a memorial within the meaning of those Regulations has been either registered, or accepted for registration, under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: rights of way;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: rights of water; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: covenants which run with the land,

paragraph.continued: existing on the date of first registration of the land;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any easements or rights (whether existing before, on or after the appointed day) which are implied by law on the disposition or transmission of the land and which are not expressly granted or reserved in any instrument;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any easements of necessity (whether existing before, on or after the appointed day);

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.leadIn: any rights, under an enactment,—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of resumption, closure, entry, search, inspection, investigation, user, repair, alteration, removal, demolition, marking, naming or planning of buildings or development, redevelopment or reinstatement of land;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to extinguish rights or to create easements or other rights;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: relating to costs, standards or specifications of any building, street or engineering works; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: affecting land or any interest in land,

paragraph.continued: and any notices, orders and certificates relating to any such rights;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: any first charge under section 18(1) of the Estate Duty Ordinance (Cap. 111), but only if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the instrument which gave rise to the charge was registered under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128) before the date of first registration of the land;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: not more than 3 years have elapsed since the date of that instrument; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the charge has not been registered under section 18(2) of the Estate Duty Ordinance (Cap. 111);

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: any first charge under section 67 of the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: any lease—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: at the best rent which can reasonably be obtained without a premium; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where the lessee is to take possession forthwith under the lease;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: any rights acquired, or in the course of being acquired, in the land where, by virtue of the Limitation Ordinance (Cap. 347), the title of the registered owner has been extinguished or will after the expiry of the appropriate period be extinguished;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.leadIn: any rights under an enactment for the erection, construction or laying of (and including the use of)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: electricity supply lines;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: telephone lines or poles;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: telegraph lines or poles;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: pipelines (including sewage tunnels);

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: aqueducts;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: canals;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: wires;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: dams; or

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: telecommunications facilities.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3) and (5), the Registrar may, as he thinks fit, register an overriding interest.

The Registrar shall, on application presented to him by the relevant authority established or referred to in an enactment referred to in subsection (1)(g), register a notice, order or certificate referred to in that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration of an overriding interest in such manner as it thinks fit and specified in the order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the removal or alteration of an entry in the Title Register referring to an overriding interest.

subsection.content: The Registrar shall give effect to an order made under subsection (4) in accordance with the provisions of the order.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: application presented to him by a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: affected by an overriding interest which has been registered; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: who, in the opinion of the Registrar, is otherwise concerned with the interest; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof to his satisfaction that the interest has, for whatever reason, ceased to affect the registered land concerned,

subsection.continued: remove the entry in the Title Register referring to that interest.

subsection.content: The Registrar may, on application presented to him by the owner of registered land or the lessee of a registered long term lease, issue to the owner or lessee a certificate in the specified form showing, or referring to, all current entries in the Title Register affecting the land or lease.

subsection.leadIn: Where only part of the registered land or interest in the registered long term lease which is the subject of a title certificate is dealt with in a transfer or transmission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the title certificate shall accompany the application for registration of the transfer or transmission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar shall cancel that title certificate upon the registration of the application.

subsection.content: A title certificate shall be admissible as evidence of the matters contained in the certificate as on the date of its issue.

Notwithstanding what is shown, or referred to, in a title certificate, the Title Register shall be conclusive evidence of the title to the registered land and interest in the registered long term lease and the other matters shown on the Title Register.

Except in the circumstances permitted under the regulations, if a title certificate has been issued for registered land or a registered long term lease, a transfer or transmission shall not be registered in respect of the land or lease unless the certificate is returned for cancellation.

subsection.leadIn: After the Registrar has issued a title certificate for registered land or a registered long term lease, he—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall make a note in the Title Register that the certificate has been issued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (7), shall not issue another title certificate in respect of the land or lease unless the first certificate is cancelled.

subsection.content: A new title certificate may be issued, in accordance with the regulations, in place of a title certificate which has been lost or destroyed or which for any other reason needs to be replaced.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that a title certificate is subject to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any overriding interest; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any subsequent entry in the Title Register,

subsection.continued: affecting the registered land or the registered long term lease to which the certificate relates.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a person may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the presentation to the Registrar of an application for a search or inspection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with the regulations,

subsection.continued: have made available any thing required under section 4, 5 or 6 to be kept in the Land Registry.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not operate to entitle a person to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have made available any thing referred to in section 4, 5 or 6 in a manner not expressly permitted under the regulations (or, where more than one manner is so permitted, in any one such manner as the Registrar decides);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have made available, in respect of the application concerned, any document for the purposes of, or as a result of, the search to which the application relates other than any such document expressly permitted to be so made available under the regulations.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other enactment, a document purporting to be a copy, print or extract—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: of or from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Title Register (including any part thereof);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the applications register (including any part thereof);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any document, or any microfilm, image record or other record of a document, kept in the Land Registry under section 6 (including any part thereof);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any specified form (including any part thereof);

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.leadIn: any other document (including any part thereof)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: which is filed or deposited in the Land Registry under the provisions of this Ordinance or any other enactment; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: which otherwise belongs to the Land Registry; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: any endorsement on the Title Register, the applications register or any document, record or form referred to in subparagraph (iii), (iv) or (v); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: bearing a certificate, with the signature or the printed signature of the Registrar, or of any other person authorized by him in that behalf, certifying that the document is a true copy, print or extract,

subsection.continued: shall, subject to the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117), and to the same extent as the original of the document, be admissible in evidence in any proceedings before any court on its production without further proof and, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, the court shall presume that—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the signature or the printed signature and certification to the document is that of the Registrar or a person authorized by him in that behalf; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the document is a true and correct copy, print or extract.

subsection.content: No solicitor, trustee or other person in a fiduciary position shall be liable in damages for any loss occasioned by the inaccuracy of a document first-mentioned in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), no process for compelling the production of any thing referred to in subsection (1)(a) shall be issued from any court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: except with the leave of the court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless the process has a statement on it to the effect that it is issued with the leave of the court.

subsection.content: A court shall not grant leave for a process referred to in subsection (3) to be issued if it is satisfied that a document first-mentioned in subsection (1) is sufficient for the purposes of the process.
Nothing in this section shall prejudice the admissibility of any evidence which would be admissible apart from the provisions of this section.

Subject to subsection (2), no disposition of registered land or a registered long term lease or any interest in or over registered land or a registered long term lease shall be effectual to create, extinguish, transfer, vary or affect the land or lease or any interest in or over the land or lease unless and until the disposition is registered under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this section shall be construed as preventing an interest in or over registered land or a registered long term lease which is not registered under this Ordinance from taking effect in equity if the interest is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: capable of registration under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: protected by an entry in the Title Register.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) shall not operate to limit, restrict, or qualify the operation of any other provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The death of a person by or on behalf of whom an instrument has been executed shall not of itself affect the validity of the instrument where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the death occurred after the instrument was executed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the instrument was valid at the time it was executed,

subsection.continued: and, accordingly, the instrument may be presented to the Registrar for registration as if the death had not occurred.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), where an application for the registration of any dealing is presented to the Registrar for registration later than 3 months after the date of the instrument supporting the application, then, in addition to the prescribed fee payable in respect of the application, an additional fee equal to that prescribed fee shall be payable for each month or part of a month which has elapsed since the date of that instrument.

No additional fee payable under subsection (1) in respect of the registration of a dealing shall exceed 10 times the prescribed fee that would have been payable in respect of the application which relates to the dealing if that dealing had been registered on the date of the instrument supporting the application.
The Registrar may remit, either in whole or in part, any additional fee payable under subsection (1) where to do so is in his opinion just and equitable in all the circumstances of the case.

Where the Registrar is satisfied that a person, without reasonable excuse, has failed to present to the Registrar an application for the registration of a dealing, the Registrar may, by notice in writing served on the person, require that person to present the application to the Registrar not later than 30 days after the notice is so served.

subsection.leadIn: Where an application in relation to which a notice has been issued under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is presented to the Registrar on a date on or before the expiration of 30 days after the service of the notice—

subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee payable in respect of the application; and
any additional fee payable under section 33 in respect of the application,

paragraph.continued: shall become due and payable on that date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is not presented to the Registrar on a date on or before the expiration of 30 days after the service of the notice—

subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee payable in respect of the application; and
any additional fee payable under section 33 in respect of the application,

paragraph.continued: shall become due and payable on the day immediately following the expiration of those 30 days.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3), (4), (5) and (6) and section 9 of Schedule 1, matters appearing in the Title Register shall have priority according to the order in which the applications which led to their registration were presented to the Registrar, irrespective of the dates of the applications (including the dates of the instruments, if any, supporting the applications) and notwithstanding that the actual entry in the Title Register may be delayed.

Where a first charge under the provisions of any enactment is not an overriding interest, then, in so far as the charge relates to land, and notwithstanding those provisions or the fact that the term “first charge” is used therein, that charge shall have priority as determined in accordance with subsection (1).

Any first charges arising under section 67(2) of the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117) shall have priority according to the order in which the instruments to which they respectively relate were registered under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128), irrespective of the order in which any such charges are registered under this Ordinance and notwithstanding the operation of section 67(4) of the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117).

subsection.leadIn: It is hereby declared that where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a consent caution (“first consent caution”) referred to in section 71(3) has been registered in respect of a dealing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provisional agreement for sale and purchase or agreement for sale and purchase to which the first consent caution relates is stamped or endorsed under the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: another consent caution (“second consent caution”), accompanied by that stamped or endorsed provisional agreement for sale and purchase or agreement for sale and purchase, as the case may be, is registered in respect of that dealing not later than 30 days after the registration of the first consent caution,

subsection.continued: then the second consent caution shall enjoy the same priority as the first consent caution, as if it had been registered on the same date as the first consent caution.

subsection.content: If a consent caution is registered in relation to an interest under a provisional agreement for sale and purchase or an agreement for sale and purchase, then, upon the registration of the dealing to which the consent caution relates, the priority of all matters registered after that consent caution is registered shall be postponed as against that dealing.
A charging order or non-consent caution which is duly registered shall have priority from the commencement of the day following the date of its registration.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Charging orders and lis pendens, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2), (3) and (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration of a charging order shall cease to have effect immediately upon the expiration of 5 years from the date of registration of the order but the order may be re-registered from time to time and, if so re-registered, the re-registration of the order shall have effect for another 5 years from the date of re-registration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the re-registration of a charging order is made before the expiration of a current period of registration or re-registration of the order, then the order shall retain its original priority.

subsection.content: The operation of subsection (1) in respect of a charging order shall be subject to any express stipulation to the contrary contained in the order except any such stipulation which purports to provide that the registration of the order shall have effect for a period longer than 5 years from the date of registration.
The variation of a registered charging order shall be effected by the registration of an order of a court of competent jurisdiction providing for the variation.

The discharge of a registered charging order shall be effected by the removal of the entry in the Title Register referring to the order consequent upon the presentation to the Registrar of an order of a court of competent jurisdiction providing for the discharge.

Without prejudice to the generality of any other provisions of this Ordinance under which the registration of a judgment, order or lis pendens may be removed or withdrawn, subsections (1) and (2) shall, with all necessary modifications, apply to a judgment, order or lis pendens as they apply to a charging order.
A charging order, judgment or order shall be registered in the manner prescribed by the regulations.

subsection.leadIn: A charge on registered land or a registered long term lease shall be effected by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its registration as an incumbrance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration of the person in whose favour it is made as its owner.

subsection.content: Where, in relation to a registered charge which is a charge to which Part 8 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) applies, there is any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Ordinance and the provisions of that Part, then the provisions of that Part (including that Part as read with any other provisions of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to which it is subject) shall, to the extent of the conflict or inconsistency, as the case may be, prevail over the provisions of this Ordinance. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered charge shall not operate as a transfer of the registered land or the registered long term lease which is subject to the charge but shall have effect as a security only; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the registered charge is a mortgage effected by a legal charge within the meaning of section 2 of the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219), the registration of the charge under this Ordinance shall not affect the operation of section 44(2) of that Ordinance.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Second or subsequent charges
section.leadIn: The owner of registered land, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, which is subject to a registered charge may effect a second or subsequent registered charge in the same manner as a first registered charge and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), for that purpose the provisions of this Ordinance which apply to a first registered charge shall apply to a second or subsequent registered charge in the same manner as those provisions apply to a first registered charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any power of sale expressed or implied in a second or subsequent registered charge shall be subject to all prior registered charges which have not been discharged.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Charge on registered charge
section.text: The owner of a registered charge may effect a charge on any interest he has in the registered charge and any charge so effected may be registered as an incumbrance specifying the person in whose favour it is made as the owner.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Discharge or partial discharge of registered charge
section.leadIn: A discharge or partial discharge of a registered charge shall be effected by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a discharge, the removal of the entry in the Title Register referring to the charge;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a partial discharge, the alteration of the entry in the Title Register referring to the charge or its removal or substitution by a new entry, as the case may require.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Satisfaction of registered charge
section.leadIn: On proof to the satisfaction of the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that all money or money’s worth due under a registered charge has been paid to the chargee or by his direction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that there has been fulfilment of all the conditions to which a registered charge relates;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that part of money or money’s worth due under a registered charge has been paid to the chargee or by his direction; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that there has been fulfilment of some of the conditions to which a registered charge relates,

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in the case of paragraph (a) or (b), remove the entry in the Title Register referring to the charge;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in the case of paragraph (c) or (d), alter the entry in the Title Register referring to the charge or remove the entry or substitute a new entry, as the case may require.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), an instrument providing for a floating charge, whether or not it specifically identifies any registered land or registered long term lease charged, shall not be registrable as a charge.

subsection.leadIn: An instrument providing for a floating charge becomes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an instrument providing for a fixed charge on the registered land or the registered long term lease intended to be affected; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: registrable as a charge on that land or lease,

subsection.continued: upon crystallization of that charge as evidenced by a certificate signed by or on behalf of the chargee.

subsection.content: An instrument providing for a fixed charge and a floating charge shall be registrable as a charge on the registered land or the registered long term lease which is subject to the fixed charge.

subsection.leadIn: A transfer of registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease shall be effected by the registration of the transferee as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owner of the registered land;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the owner of the registered charge; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the lessee of the registered long term lease,

subsection.continued: as the case may be.

subsection.content: The transferee of a registered charge may require the chargor to execute the transfer for the purpose of acknowledging the amount due under the charge at the date of execution of the transfer, and the chargor shall comply with that requirement accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the Registrar shall not accept an application the registration of which will effect a division of registered land unless, in respect of each of the parcels of land to result from the division, the instrument accompanying the application and providing for the division is accompanied by a land boundary plan—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: showing and delineating those parcels; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (4), signed and certified by an authorized land surveyor.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsections (3) and (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), it shall not be necessary for an instrument referred to in subsection (1) to be accompanied by a land boundary plan referred to in subsection (1) where the division of registered land concerned is provided for by a will or judgment and that instrument is the grant of probate in respect of the will, or the judgment, as the case may be;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it shall be necessary for an instrument accompanying an application presented for the registration of a dealing to effect the passing of title to any parcel of land resulting from that division to be accompanied by such a land boundary plan.

subsection.content: It shall not be necessary for an instrument referred to in subsection (1) or (2)(b) to be accompanied by a land boundary plan referred to in that subsection if the instrument was executed before the commencement of section 30 of the Land Survey Ordinance (Cap. 473).

subsection.leadIn: It shall not be necessary for a land boundary plan—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: accompanying an instrument referred to in subsection (1) or (2)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which has been prepared by the Government,

subsection.continued: to be signed and certified by an authorized land surveyor.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provisions of this Ordinance shall not prejudice the operation of section 35 of the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no reference to a covenant implied under that section shall be entered in the Title Register.

subsection.content: Where a covenant implied under section 35 of the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219) is to be excluded, varied or extended in a transfer of registered land or a registered charge, express reference shall be made to the covenant so excluded, varied or extended in the instrument supporting the transfer or registered charge.

Where a transfer or charge is supported by an instrument mentioned in subsection (2), then the registration of the transfer or charge shall of itself effect the registration of the covenant implied under section 35 of the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219) as varied or extended by the transfer or charge.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Provisions as between vendor and purchaser

subsection.leadIn: On a sale of registered land or a registered long term lease to a purchaser—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the vendor shall, subject to any stipulation to the contrary, provide the purchaser with—

subparagraph.content: a copy of the current entries in the Title Register;
a copy of any instrument referred to in any such entry;
a copy of any plan referred to in any such entry or instrument; and
such other documents as may be prescribed by the regulations,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the vendor shall, subject to subsection (2) and to any stipulation to the contrary, at his own expense provide the purchaser with particulars of any overriding interests affecting the land or lease of which he has, or ought reasonably to have, knowledge; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the vendor is not the owner of the land or of a registered charge giving a power of sale over the land, or the lessee of the lease, he shall, at the request of the purchaser and at his own expense, and notwithstanding any stipulation to the contrary, procure—

subparagraph.content: the registration of himself as the owner of the land or charge or the lessee of the lease; or
a disposition of the land, charge or lease from the owner to the purchaser.

subsection.leadIn: Where, on the first transfer on or after the date of first registration of land, the vendor has, or ought reasonably to have, knowledge of an overriding interest which might affect the land—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vendor shall, notwithstanding any stipulation to the contrary, and whether under subsection (1)(b) or otherwise, at his own expense provide the purchaser of the land with full particulars of the interest; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the purchaser shall include the particulars provided to him under paragraph (a) in the application presented to the Registrar for the registration of the transfer.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding any stipulation to the contrary, on a sale of registered land or a registered long term lease, a purchaser shall only be entitled to require from the vendor the matters required to be provided by the vendor to the purchaser under this section.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Transfer subject to lease
section.leadIn: A transfer of registered land or a registered long term lease which is subject to a lease shall be valid without the lessee of the last-mentioned lease acknowledging the transferee as lessor, but nothing in this section shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: affect the validity of any payment of rents made by the lessee to the transferor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: render the lessee liable, on account of his failure to pay rents to the transferee, for any breach of agreement to pay rents,

section.continued: before a notice of the transfer is given to the lessee by the transferor or transferee.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Leases other than long term leases

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grant of a lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any transaction concerning a lease where the lessee’s interest in the lease is or is to be affected by the transaction.

def.name: Lease
def.leadIn: In this section, “lease” (租契) does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a lease which is an overriding interest;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a lease of any land which is not registered land; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a long term lease.

subsection.content: An application for the registration of a long term lease shall be made by the first lessee of the long term lease granted by the owner of the registered land on or after the date of first registration of the land.

subsection.leadIn: Where, on the grant of a long term lease by the owner of the registered land on or after the date of first registration of the land, the owner has, or ought reasonably to have, knowledge of an overriding interest which might affect the long term lease—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owner shall, notwithstanding any stipulation to the contrary, at his own expense provide the first lessee of the long term lease with full particulars of the interest; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the first lessee shall include the particulars provided to him under paragraph (a) in the application presented to the Registrar under subsection (1).

subsection.content: The Registrar may register a long term lease which is the subject of an application under subsection (1) if the Registrar is satisfied that the application complies with the provisions of this Ordinance applicable to it.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall register a long term lease which is the subject of an application under subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making an entry in the Title Register specifying that the applicant is the lessee of the long term lease; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: entering such other particulars in the Title Register relating to the lease as the Registrar considers appropriate.

subsection.content: The date of first registration of a long term lease registered under this section shall be the date on which the application for registration of the lease was delivered to the Land Registry.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Termination of leases
section.leadIn: Where a registered lease is terminated (whether by surrender, forfeiture, re-entry or otherwise), the Registrar shall remove the entry in the Title Register referring to the lease on the presentation of an application to the Registrar therefor together with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument, if any, providing for the termination; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other evidence as satisfies the Registrar that the lease has been terminated.

subsection.leadIn: An instrument creating, or evidencing the existence of, an easement shall specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the easement, the period for which it is granted and any conditions, limitations or restrictions intended to affect its enjoyment;

paragraph.name: b
