paragraph.content: the registered land or the registered long term lease burdened by the easement and, if required by the Registrar, the particular part of the land so burdened; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the registered land or the registered long term lease which enjoys the benefit of the easement and, if required by the Registrar, the particular part of the land so benefited.

subsection.content: The registration of an easement shall be effected by the entering in the Title Register of particulars of the instrument creating, or evidencing the existence of, the easement both in respect of the registered land or the registered long term lease burdened and the registered land or the registered long term lease benefited by the easement.

subsection.leadIn: Where an instrument, other than a lease or charge, provides for a covenant (whether positive or restrictive in effect)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which relates to registered land or a registered long term lease of the covenantor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the burden of which is expressed or intended to run with the registered land or the registered long term lease of the covenantor; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which is expressed and intended to benefit the registered land or the registered long term lease of the covenantee and his successors in title or persons deriving title to that land or lease under or through him or them,

subsection.continued: the registration of the covenant shall be effected by the entering in the Title Register of particulars of that instrument both in respect of the registered land or the registered long term lease burdened and the registered land or the registered long term lease benefited by the covenant.

subsection.content: Subject to section 28, an instrument providing for a covenant shall not affect registered land or a registered long term lease unless particulars of the instrument are entered in the Title Register.

subsection.def: In this section, “covenant” (契諾) does not include a deed of mutual covenant within the meaning of section 53.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that this section shall not prejudice the operation of section 45.

subsection.leadIn: The registration of a deed of mutual covenant shall be effected by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its registration as an incumbrance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: entering particulars of the deed in the Title Register.

subsection.leadIn: The registration of any alteration or addition to a registered deed of mutual covenant shall be effected by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: adding to or altering the entry in the Title Register referring to the deed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: removing that entry and substituting a new entry in relation to the deed.

subsection.content: On proof to the satisfaction of the Registrar that a registered deed of mutual covenant, including any registered alterations or additions, has been extinguished or otherwise terminated, the Registrar shall remove the entry in the Title Register referring to the deed.

The registration of a deed of mutual covenant under this section shall also effect the registration of any easement, right or covenant provided for in the deed which affects the registered land or registered long term lease concerned.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: “deed of mutual covenant” (公契) includes a document which defines the rights, interests and obligations of owners among themselves;
“owner” (業主) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Building Management Ordinance (Cap. 344).

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that, except to the extent provided by this Ordinance, nothing in this section shall prejudice the operation of sections 39, 40 and 41 of the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219).

section.name: s54
section.heading: Release and extinguishment of registered easements and covenants

subsection.leadIn: On the registration of an executed release in respect of a registered easement or covenant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the easement or covenant is thereupon extinguished; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar shall remove the entry in the Title Register referring to that easement or covenant.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall, on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: application presented to him by a person affected by a registered easement or covenant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: proof to his satisfaction that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the period for which the easement or covenant was intended to exist has expired;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the event upon which the easement or covenant was intended to determine has occurred; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the easement or covenant has otherwise ceased to have effect,

subsection.continued: remove the entry in the Title Register referring to that easement or covenant.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Modification or partial extinguishment of registered easements and covenants
section.leadIn: The Registrar shall register an application for the modification or partial extinguishment of a registered easement or covenant where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application is accompanied by an instrument providing for the modification or partial extinguishment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that each owner of the registered land or each lessee of the registered long term lease burdened or benefited by the easement or covenant consents to the modification or partial extinguishment.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Saving of certain rights
section.text: Nothing in this Ordinance shall be construed as altering any rule of law which implies in the grant or reservation of an easement such ancillary rights as are necessary for effective enjoyment of the easement.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Registration of more than one owner

subsection.leadIn: An instrument providing for a transfer made in favour of 2 or more persons shall not be registered unless it shows, in respect of the registered land or the registered long term lease to which it relates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the persons are joint tenants or tenants in common; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the persons are tenants in common, the share of each owner or lessee.

subsection.content: The entry made in the Title Register to effect the registration of an instrument referred to in subsection (1) shall show the particulars required to be shown in that instrument under paragraphs (a) and (b) of that subsection.

section.name: s58
section.heading: No interference with rights of succession, etc.
section.leadIn: Nothing in this Ordinance shall be construed as affecting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a right which the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, has to make a will, under the law relating to testamentary disposition, disposing of the land, charge or lease on his death;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the law of intestate succession;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a right of succession to land under Part II of the New Territories Ordinance (Cap. 97) (including that Part as read with section 12 of the New Territories Land (Exemption) Ordinance (Cap. 452)); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the operation of section 15 or 18 of the New Territories Ordinance (Cap. 97).

subsection.leadIn: A disposition of registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease, or the grant or reservation of an easement over registered land or a registered long term lease, may be made in any manner as could have been done prior to the date of first registration of the land or lease except where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such a disposition, grant or reservation is required to be made by an instrument in the specified form and there is such a specified form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notwithstanding that such a disposition, grant or reservation is not required to be made by an instrument in the specified form, the Registrar has exercised his power under section 99 to specify the form of such an instrument.

subsection.content: An instrument, where applicable, shall contain a true statement of the amount or value of any purchase price or loan or other consideration.

Without prejudice to the operation of section 15(3) of the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117), no instrument required by law to be stamped shall be accepted for registration of any matter unless the instrument is stamped in accordance with the requirements of that Ordinance.

Subject to section 71(3) and without prejudice to the operation of section 15(3) of the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117), where an application for the registration of a consent caution, a non-consent caution, an inhibition or a restriction for the purpose of protecting an interest in registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease is supported by an instrument required by law to be stamped, the registration shall not be proceeded with unless the instrument is stamped in accordance with the requirements of the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117).

Nothing in this section enables a minor who is the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, to deal with the land, charge or lease or with an interest in the land, charge or lease.

subsection.leadIn: Where a disposition by a minor of registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease has been registered and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the disposition is made acted in good faith and for valuable consideration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fact that the minor was a minor was not disclosed to that person at any time before the registration of the disposition,

subsection.continued: that disposition shall not be set aside only on the ground that the disposition was made by a minor.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that where the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, is a minor and that fact is disclosed to the Registrar in any application for registration made by him, then the name of that minor shall be entered in the Title Register with the addition after the minor’s English name of the words “a minor” and with the addition after his Chinese name of the words “未成年人”.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the operation of sections 63, 64, 65, 66, 67 and 68, where a person becomes entitled to registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease under an order of a court of competent jurisdiction, under an enactment or by operation of law (including in the capacity of trustee), the Registrar shall, on the presentation to him by the person of such evidence as the Registrar requires, register the person so entitled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as the owner, or as the owner in the capacity of trustee, of the land or charge; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as the lessee, or as the lessee in the capacity of trustee, of the lease,

subsection.continued: as the case may require.

subsection.content: The registration of a person under subsection (1) as the owner, or as the owner in the capacity of trustee, of registered land shall be treated as only confirming that the person has the same legal estate or equitable interest and rights as would have been vested in that person if the land had been transferred to him and he had been registered as the owner of the land under section 25.

The registration of a person under subsection (1) as the lessee, or as the lessee in the capacity of trustee, of a registered long term lease shall be treated as only confirming that the person has the same interest and rights as would have been vested in that person if he had been registered as the lessee of the lease under section 26.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Transmission on death of joint tenant

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), where one of 2 or more joint tenants of registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease dies, the Registrar, on proof to his satisfaction of the death, shall remove the name of the deceased from the Title Register.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall not remove the name of a deceased from the Title Register under subsection (1) until he is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: estate duty is not payable under the Estate Duty Ordinance (Cap. 111) on the deceased’s interest in registered land or the registered long term lease concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where such estate duty is payable on such interest—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the estate duty has been paid in accordance with the provisions of that Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the payment of the estate duty has been secured to the satisfaction of the Commissioner under section 15 of the Estate Duty Ordinance (Cap. 111).

section.name: s64
section.heading: Transmission on death of sole owner or tenant in common

subsection.content: Where a sole owner or tenant in common of registered land or a registered charge dies, or a sole lessee of or one of 2 or more lessees holding as tenants in common of a registered long term lease dies, his personal representative shall, on the presentation to the Registrar of the grant concerned, be entitled to be registered as the owner of the land or charge, or as the lessee of the lease, in the place of the deceased, with the addition after the personal representative’s English name of the words “as executor of the will of . deceased” or “as administrator of the estate of . deceased”, as the case may be, and after the personal representative’s Chinese name of the words “作為死者.的遺囑執行人” or “作為死者.的遺產管理人”, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: Where a sole owner or tenant in common of registered land or a registered charge dies, or a sole lessee of or one of 2 or more lessees holding as tenants in common of a registered long term lease dies, the Registrar may, on the presentation to him of the grant concerned by the personal representative of the deceased owner or lessee, and without requiring the personal representative to be registered in accordance with subsection (1), register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a transfer of the land, charge or lease by the personal representative; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a discharge of the charge by the personal representative.

subsection.content: Where under section 17 of the New Territories Ordinance (Cap. 97) as read with section 12 of the New Territories Land (Exemption) Ordinance (Cap. 452) any registered land is vested in any person as a successor, that person shall, on the presentation to the Registrar of evidence which satisfies the Registrar that the land has so vested, be entitled to be registered as the owner of the land in place of the deceased person concerned.

def.name: Grant
def.leadIn: In this section, “grant” (授予承辦證明) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grant of the probate of the will;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the grant of letters of administration of the estate; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: evidence of the summary administration, under section 15 of the Probate and Administration Ordinance (Cap. 10), of the estate,

def.continued: of the deceased owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the deceased lessee of a registered long term lease, and includes the resealing of the grant.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Transmission on death of trustee
section.text: Where a trustee who in that capacity is registered as the owner of registered land or a registered charge dies, or where a trustee who in that capacity is registered as the trustee of a registered long term lease dies, his personal representative or any surviving or newly appointed trustee shall, on the presentation to the Registrar of such evidence as the Registrar requires, be entitled to be registered as the owner of the land or charge, or as the lessee of the lease, in the place of the deceased, with the addition after his English name of the words “as trustee” and with the addition after his Chinese name of the words “作為受託人”.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Effect of transmission on death and dealing by personal representative
section.leadIn: A personal representative who in that capacity is registered as the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or as the lessee of a registered long term lease shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be subject to any interests to which the land, charge or lease is subject at the time of registration of the personal representative as the owner or lessee, as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: without prejudice to paragraph (a), for the purposes of any dealing in the land, charge or lease, have—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: unrestricted power of sale over the land, charge or lease;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: all the rights conferred under this Ordinance or any other enactment on the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, as the case may be, who has acquired the land, charge or lease for valuable consideration.

subsection.leadIn: A trustee in bankruptcy shall, on the presentation to the Registrar of a sealed copy of the order of the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: adjudging the owner of registered land or a registered charge bankrupt, or the lessee of a registered long term lease bankrupt; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: directing that the estate of the deceased owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the deceased lessee of a registered long term lease shall be administered according to the law of bankruptcy,

subsection.continued: be entitled to be registered as the owner of the land or charge, or as the lessee of the lease, in the place of the bankrupt or deceased owner or lessee, with the addition after the English name of the trustee in bankruptcy of the words “as trustee of the property of . a bankrupt”, and with the addition after the Chinese name of the trustee in bankruptcy of the words “作為破產人.的財產的受託人”.

subsection.leadIn: A trustee in bankruptcy who in that capacity is registered as the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or as the lessee of a registered long term lease shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: be subject to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any restrictions (including any rights) provided for in the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) or any other enactment; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any interests subject to which the bankrupt or deceased owner of the land or charge or lessee of the lease held the land, charge or lease immediately prior to his bankruptcy or death;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: without prejudice to paragraph (a), for the purposes of any dealing in the land, charge or lease, have—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: unrestricted power of sale over the land, charge or lease;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: all the rights conferred under this Ordinance or any other enactment on the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, as the case may be, who has acquired the land, charge or lease for valuable consideration.

subsection.leadIn: Where a company is being wound up—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the liquidator of the company shall present to the Registrar the resolution or order under which he holds his appointment as liquidator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the presentation of the resolution or order, the Registrar shall enter the appointment in the Title Register in respect of any registered land, registered charge or registered long term lease of which the company is the owner or lessee.

subsection.leadIn: An instrument executed by or on behalf of a company being wound up presented to the Registrar for registration after the appointment of the liquidator of the company has been entered in the Title Register shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a company required by law to have a common seal, be sealed with the common seal of the company and attested by the liquidator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, be signed by the liquidator.

subsection.leadIn: Where an order has been made under section 198 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) vesting in the liquidator of a company any registered land, registered charge or registered long term lease of which the company is the owner or lessee— (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the liquidator shall present the order to the Registrar; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the presentation of the order, the Registrar shall register the liquidator as the owner or lessee, as the case may be, of the land, charge or lease.

subsection.leadIn: Where under subsection (3) the liquidator of a company is registered as the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or as the lessee of a registered long term lease, the liquidator shall be subject to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any restrictions (including any rights) provided for in the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) or any other enactment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any interests subject to which the company held the land, charge or lease immediately prior to the order made under section 198 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) by virtue of which the land, charge or lease was vested in the liquidator. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.leadIn: A person who, in the capacity of trustee (other than as a personal representative or trustee in bankruptcy)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: acquires registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: holds a registered charge;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: holds a long term lease; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: becomes the lessee of a Government lease issued on or after the appointed day,

subsection.continued: may be described by that capacity in the relevant instrument, and, if so described, shall be registered with the addition of the words “as trustee” and“作為受託人”, but the Registrar shall not enter particulars of the trust concerned in the Title Register.

subsection.content: Where the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, makes a declaration of trust in respect of the land, charge or lease, or otherwise comes to hold the land, charge or lease as a trustee (other than as a personal representative or trustee in bankruptcy), the Registrar shall, on the presentation of an application for the registration of a transfer of the land, charge or lease supported by the declaration or other instrument by virtue of which the owner comes to hold the land, charge or lease as a trustee, add the words “as trustee” after that person’s English name and add the words“作為受託人”after that person’s Chinese name in the Title Register concerned, but the Registrar shall not enter particulars of the trust concerned in the Title Register.

For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that subsections (1) and (2) shall not prevent the making of an entry of a consent caution, non-consent caution, inhibition or restriction in the Title Register by reason only of the fact that the entry contains particulars of a trust.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, in the capacity of trustee, is registered under this section as the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or as the lessee of a registered long term lease—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be subject to any interests to which the land, charge or lease is subject at the time of registration of the person as the owner or lessee, as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to paragraph (a), for the purposes of any dealing in the land, charge or lease, shall have all the rights conferred under this Ordinance or any other enactment on the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, as the case may be, who has acquired the land, charge or lease for valuable consideration.

subsection.content: No breach of the terms of the trust to which the person, land, charge or lease referred to in subsection (4) is subject shall create any right or indemnity under this Ordinance.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Protection of person dealing with trustees
section.text: Where a person, in the capacity of trustee, is registered as the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or as the lessee of a registered long term lease, he shall, in dealing with the land, charge or lease, be deemed to be the owner of that land or charge or lessee of that lease, and no disposition that amounts to a breach of trust by the trustee to a bona fide purchaser for valuable consideration shall be defeasible by reason only of the fact of that breach.

subsection.content: A person who intends to effect a dealing in registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease may present to the Registrar an application for the registration of a consent caution in respect of the dealing if he has obtained the consent of the relevant person specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), the relevant person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owner of the registered land or registered charge, or the lessee of the registered long term lease, as the case may be; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cautioner under a registered consent caution with whom any person intends to enter into a dealing in respect of an interest that the cautioner claims under that registered consent caution.

subsection.content: Where an instrument which is a provisional agreement for sale and purchase or an agreement for sale and purchase in respect of registered land or a registered long term lease has been or will be presented for stamping or endorsement under the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117), then a consent caution in respect of that dealing may be registered if the application for the registration of the consent caution is accompanied by a statutory declaration by the purchaser under the dealing to the effect that the instrument has been or will be so presented.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: claims any interest, whether contractual or otherwise, in registered land or a registered charge, or a registered long term lease; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has presented a winding-up petition against the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease,

subsection.continued: may present to the Registrar an application for the registration of a non-consent caution in respect of the claim or petition, as the case may be (and whether or not that person is the owner of that land or the lessee of that lease).

subsection.leadIn: The reference to interest in subsection (4)(a) shall include—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any case where a gift inter vivos of any property is made and estate duty would be payable by virtue of section 6(1)(c) of the Estate Duty Ordinance (Cap. 111), a first charge under section 18(1) of that Ordinance which may arise by virtue of the gift.

subsection.content: A transfer by a natural person of registered land or a registered long term lease by way of gift inter vivos shall not be registered unless there is registered at the same time a non-consent caution to the effect that, in consequence of that transfer, the land or lease is or may become subject to a first charge under section 18(1) of the Estate Duty Ordinance (Cap. 111).

Notwithstanding subsection (4), for the purposes of subsection (6), an application for the registration of a transfer referred to in subsection (6) shall be accompanied by an application for the registration of a non-consent caution referred to in subsection (6) made by the same person who makes the application for registration of the transfer.

The Commissioner, within the meaning of the Estate Duty Ordinance (Cap. 111), shall be entered in the Title Register as the cautioner in respect of a non-consent caution referred to in subsection (7) which has been registered, and the other provisions of this Ordinance (including section 73) shall be construed accordingly.
The Registrar may require the person presenting an application for the registration of a consent caution or non-consent caution to support the application by such evidence as the Registrar requires.
Subject to subsections (11) and (12), the Registrar shall register a consent caution or non-consent caution.

The Registrar may refuse to register a consent caution or non-consent caution the purpose of which he considers can be effected by an entry in the Title Register other than an entry referring to the caution.

An instrument providing for a floating charge, whether or not it specifically identifies any registered land or registered long term lease charged, shall not be treated as providing for a matter registrable as a consent caution or non-consent caution.
A lis pendens shall be treated as providing for a matter registrable as a non-consent caution.

Where a consent caution has been registered in respect of registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease, the consent caution shall not of itself prohibit the registration of matters in the Title Register affecting the land, charge or lease.

Where a non-consent caution has been registered in respect of registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease, the non-consent caution shall not of itself prohibit the making of entries in the Title Register affecting the land, charge or lease.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the registration of a consent caution shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of itself affect the validity or otherwise of the interest which is the subject of the consent caution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (a), constitute a warranty, or a guarantee, as to the validity of the interest which is the subject of the consent caution.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the registration of a non-consent caution shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of itself affect the validity or otherwise of the winding-up petition or claim which is the subject of the non-consent caution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (a), constitute a warranty, or a guarantee, as to the validity of the winding-up petition or claim.

subsection.content: A consent caution or non-consent caution may be withdrawn on the presentation to the Registrar by the cautioner of an application for the withdrawal of the caution.

subsection.leadIn: A consent caution or non-consent caution may be removed on the presentation to the Registrar of an application for its removal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in any case, by a person who has obtained an order of the Court for its removal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a consent caution, by the owner of the registered land or the registered charge, or the lessee of the registered long term lease, affected by the caution, but only if the Registrar is satisfied that the cautioner has agreed to its removal; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a non-consent caution, by the owner of the registered land or the registered charge, or the lessee of the registered long term lease, affected by the caution, but only if the Registrar—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is satisfied that the owner or lessee has provided a copy of the application to the cautioner not less than 14 days before the presentation of the application to the Registrar; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that the caution was wrongfully registered;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that the ground on which the caution was registered no longer exists; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: that the cautioner consents to the removal of the caution.

subsection.leadIn: Where the subject of a non-consent caution is a first charge under section 18(1) of the Estate Duty Ordinance (Cap. 111), then the Registrar may be satisfied for the purposes of subsection (2)(c)(ii) if the application referred to in that subsection is accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statutory declaration made by the donor concerned, not less than 3 years after the date on which the gift concerned was made, that he is still alive;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a death certificate showing a date of death of the donor concerned which is a date not less than 3 years after the date on which the gift concerned was made;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other evidence proving that the donor concerned is or was alive not less than 3 years after the date on which the gift concerned was made; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: papers proving that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the estate duty (including any interest thereon) to which the charge relates has been paid; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: no estate duty is required to be paid in respect of the land or lease to which the charge relates.

subsection.content: The Registrar may require the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, presenting an application for the removal of a consent caution or non-consent caution under subsection (2)(b) or (c) to support the application by such evidence as the Registrar requires.

A person with an interest in registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease affected by a consent caution or non-consent caution may apply by originating summons to the Court for the removal of the caution, and the Court may make such order on the originating summons and as to costs as to the Court appears just.

subsection.leadIn: On the withdrawal or removal of a consent caution or non-consent caution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar shall remove the entry in the Title Register referring to the caution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any liability of the cautioner previously incurred under section 74 shall not be affected by the removal of that entry.

subsection.content: The Registrar shall give effect to an order made under subsection (2)(a) or (5) in accordance with the provisions of the order.

subsection.leadIn: A person who applies to register a consent caution or non-consent caution without reasonable cause shall be liable, in an action for damages at the suit of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owner of the registered land or registered charge concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the lessee of the registered long term lease concerned; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person who has an interest in the land, charge or lease,

subsection.continued: to pay compensation to the owner, lessee or other person for any damage sustained thereby, in such amount as to the Court appears just.

subsection.content: A cautioner under a registered consent caution or non-consent caution who fails, without reasonable excuse, to apply to the Registrar for the withdrawal of the caution within a reasonable period of time after the ground on which it was registered ceases to exist, shall be liable, in an action for damages at the suit of a person referred to in subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c), to pay compensation to that person for any damage sustained thereby, in such amount as to the Court appears just.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Power of Court to inhibit dealings

subsection.leadIn: The Court may, if it appears to the Court that it is necessary or desirable to do so for the purpose of protecting an interest or claim in relation to registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease, make an order inhibiting the registration of any dealing in the land, charge or lease, on such terms and conditions as it thinks fit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a particular period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: until the occurrence of a particular event; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: generally until the making of a further order by the Court.

subsection.content: The person who has obtained an inhibition shall present to the Registrar an application for the registration of the inhibition, supported by a copy of the inhibition under seal of the Court, and on such presentation the Registrar shall register the inhibition.
An inhibition shall not affect registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease until the inhibition has been registered.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Effect of inhibitions
section.text: While an inhibition remains registered, no dealing which is inconsistent with it shall be registered.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Removal of inhibitions
section.leadIn: The registration of an inhibition shall not be removed from the Title Register except on the presentation to the Registrar of an application for the removal of that registration on one or more of the following grounds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the expiration of the period limited by the inhibition;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on proof to the satisfaction of the Registrar of the occurrence of the event specified in the inhibition;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on the registered land or the registered charge affected by the inhibition being sold by a chargee, unless such sale is itself inhibited; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by order of the Court.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, in respect of registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after an application for an order under this section being presented to him by an interested person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: after—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: directing such inquiries to be made and notices to be served as he thinks fit; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: giving such persons as appear to the Registrar from the Title Register may be affected by the order an opportunity of being heard; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: after being satisfied that the powers of the owner of the registered land or the registered charge, or of the lessee of the registered long term lease, to deal in the land, charge or lease should be restricted to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: prevent invalidity or unlawfulness in relation to dealing in the land, charge or lease; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: protect an interest or claim in relation to the land, charge or lease,

subsection.continued: make an order prohibiting—

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: all dealings in the land, charge or lease;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such dealings in the land, charge or lease as do not comply with conditions specified in the order.

subsection.leadIn: A restriction may be expressed to endure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a particular period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: until the occurrence of a particular event; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: generally until the making of a further order by the Registrar.

subsection.content: The Registrar shall register an order made under subsection (1).
A restriction shall not affect registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease until the restriction has been registered.

def.name: InterestedPerson
def.leadIn: In this section, “interested person” (利害關係人), in relation to registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease, means a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is the owner of the land or charge or the lessee of the lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is entitled to be registered as the owner of the land or charge or the lessee of the lease; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: who falls within a class of persons prescribed by the regulations for the purposes of this section.

subsection.content: The Registrar shall, as soon as reasonably practicable, give notice in writing of a restriction to the owner of the registered land or the registered charge, or the lessee of the registered long term lease, affected by the restriction.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 28(2), while a restriction remains registered, no dealing in the registered land, registered charge or registered long term lease concerned which is inconsistent with the restriction shall be registered except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with the consent of the Registrar; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by order of the Court.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, in respect of a restriction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on application for the removal or variation of the restriction presented to him by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, affected by the restriction; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other interested person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after giving the persons affected by the restriction an opportunity of being heard,

subsection.continued: remove or alter the entry in the Title Register referring to the restriction.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may, in respect of a restriction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on application made to it by the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease, affected by the restriction or any other interested person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after notice of the application referred to in paragraph (a) has been given to the Registrar,

subsection.continued: order the restriction to be removed or varied, or make such other orders as to the Court appears just, and may make an order as to costs.

subsection.content: The Registrar shall give effect to an order made under subsection (2) in accordance with the provisions of the order.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may rectify any error or omission in the Title Register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on his own volition, if the rectification will not materially affect the interest of the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on application presented to him by any person, if the applicant proves to the satisfaction of the Registrar that the error or omission is of a clerical nature only and that the rectification will not materially affect the interest of the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case, with the consent of all persons interested.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on application presented to him by a person stating that there has been a change in his name; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on proof to his satisfaction of that change,

subsection.continued: make an entry in the Title Register to record the change if that person’s former name is the subject of an entry in the Title Register.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pursuant to section 61(3), the name of a minor is entered in the Title Register as the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or as the lessee of a registered long term lease; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the owner or lessee, as the case may be, attains full age,

subsection.continued: then the owner or lessee, as the case may be, may make an application to the Registrar to remove the words in the Title Register which describe him as a minor.

subsection.content: On receipt of an application under subsection (3), the Registrar shall, if he is satisfied that the owner or lessee concerned has attained full age, remove the words in the Title Register which describe him as a minor.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3) and section 83, the Court may, on application by any person, order the rectification of the Title Register by directing that an entry therein relating to registered land or a registered long term lease be removed or altered, or that an entry relating to registered land or a registered long term lease which has been omitted from the Title Register be entered therein, if the Court is satisfied that the entry was obtained, made or omitted, as the case may be, by or as a result of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fraud, mistake or omission of any person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a void or voidable instrument.

subsection.leadIn: No order may be made under subsection (1) so as to affect the title of a person who is the registered owner of registered land or the registered lessee of a registered long term lease, and who is in possession of the land and has acquired the land or lease for valuable consideration, unless the Court is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the name of such person was entered in the Title Register as the owner or lessee, as the case may be, by or directly as a result of the fraud, mistake or omission in question or the void or voidable instrument in question, as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of fraud, the person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: was a party to the fraud;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: had knowledge of the fraud at the time his name was so entered in the Title Register; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: had, by his act or by lack of proper care, substantially contributed to the fraud;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of a mistake or omission, the person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: caused the mistake or omission;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: had knowledge of the mistake or omission at the time his name was so entered in the Title Register; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: had, by his act or by lack of proper care, substantially contributed to the mistake or omission; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of a void or voidable instrument, the person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: caused the instrument to be void or voidable, as the case may be;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: had knowledge that the instrument was void or voidable, as the case may be, at the time his name was so entered in the Title Register; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: had, by his act or by lack of proper care, substantially contributed to making the instrument void or voidable, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 83, on an application made under subsection (1) by a former registered owner of registered land or a former registered lessee of a registered long term lease to restore his title to the land or lease on the ground that he lost his title by or as a result of fraud, the Court shall order the rectification of the Title Register to so restore the title of the applicant (and irrespective of whoever is currently the registered owner or registered lessee of the land or lease concerned), if the Court is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the entry in the Title Register by or as result of which the applicant lost his title was procured, whether in whole or in part, by or as a result of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a void instrument; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a false entry in the Title Register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant was not a party to the fraud; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant did not, by his act or by lack of proper care, substantially contribute to the fraud.

subsection.content: An order may be made under subsection (1) or (3) whether or not the entry in the Title Register in question was obtained, made or omitted, as the case may be, before, on or after the date of first registration of the registered land or registered long term lease concerned.
The Registrar shall give effect to an order made under subsection (1) or (3) in accordance with the provisions of the order.
This section is without prejudice to the operation of section 3(4)(c).
The Court may make such order as to the costs of proceedings under this section as to the Court appears just.
Any costs of proceedings awarded against the Registrar in any proceedings under this section shall be paid out of the Land Titles Indemnity Fund.

For the purpose of subsection (2), a person who is in receipt of rents or profits, or who has the right to receive rents or profits, in respect of the registered land or registered long term lease concerned shall be treated as being in possession of the land.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Time for bringing proceedings under section 82

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), no application for the rectification of the Title Register may be made under section 82 after the end of the period of 12 years from the date on which the entry in the Title Register in question was obtained, made or omitted, as the case may be.
The Limitation Ordinance (Cap. 347) shall apply, with necessary modifications, to an application for the rectification of the Title Register under section 82.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (4)(b) and (c) and sections 85 and 87, a person suffering loss by reason of an entry in, or an entry omitted from, the Title Register, where such entry has been obtained, made or omitted, as the case may be, by or as the result of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: fraud—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on the part of any person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which affects the ownership of the registered land concerned or the registration of a person as the lessee of a registered long term lease; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to which an order under section 82(1) or (3) relates (and whether or not the order grants or refuses the relevant application for rectification); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any mistake or omission on the part of any person referred to in section 11(3),

subsection.continued: shall be entitled to be indemnified by the Government in respect of that loss.

subsection.leadIn: No indemnity shall be payable under subsection (1) to a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has himself caused or substantially contributed to the loss by his fraud or negligence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: derives title (otherwise than under a registered disposition made in good faith and for valuable consideration) from a person who so caused or substantially contributed to the loss.

subsection.def: In this section, “omission” (遺漏) does not include a failure to deliver an application for registration.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: nothing in this Ordinance shall affect the validity or otherwise of any claim made under section 23A of the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128) before the date of first registration of the registered land or registered long term lease concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: no indemnity shall be payable under subsection (1) in respect of any fraud, mistake or omission discovered (whether in proceedings before any court or otherwise)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), before the date of first registration of the registered land concerned and irrespective of whether any claim in respect thereof has been, or could have been, or could not have been, made under section 23A of the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128) before that date; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: before the date of first registration of the registered long term lease concerned and irrespective of whether any claim in respect thereof has been, or could have been, or could not have been, made under section 23A of the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128) before that date;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: no indemnity shall be payable under subsection (1) in respect of any fraud, mistake or omission—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), which occurred before the date of first registration of the registered land concerned and is discovered (whether in proceedings before any court or otherwise) on or after that date; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which occurred before the date of first registration of the registered long term lease concerned and is discovered (whether in proceedings before any court or otherwise) on or after that date;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: no indemnity shall be payable under subsection (1) in respect of any fraud, mistake or omission in relation to land which is not registered land (including any lease to which the land is subject), and whether or not the fraud, mistake or omission occurred before, on or after the appointed day.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (4)(b) and (c) and sections 85 and 87, for the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that where the Title Register is rectified under section 82(1) or (3), the registered owner of the land or the registered lessee of the long term lease who is deprived of the property in consequence of the rectification may make a claim for indemnity.

subsection.leadIn: The amount of any indemnity payable under section 84(1) shall not exceed, in respect of each entry referred to in that section in respect of which an indemnity is payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of any such entry obtained, made or omitted by or as the result of fraud on the part of any person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the value of the interest in the registered land or registered long term lease concerned on the date on which such entry was obtained, made or omitted; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount from time to time determined under subsection (3) for the purposes of this subsection as such amount is in force immediately before the discovery of the fraud,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the value of the interest in the registered land or registered long term lease concerned on the date on which the mistake or omission concerned was made.

subsection.leadIn: Where 2 or more persons have ceased to be the owners of registered land or the lessees of a registered long term lease in consequence of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order being made under section 82(1) or (3) for the rectification of the Title Register on the ground of fraud; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a fraud referred to in section 84(1),

subsection.continued: and, in consequence of that cesser, those persons are entitled to be paid an indemnity under section 84(1), then the total of the indemnity shall not exceed the amount referred to in subsection (1)(a).

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, determine an amount for the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(ii).
For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that a notice under subsection (3) is subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall, on application in the specified form made to him by an interested person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine whether a right of indemnity has arisen under this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if he determines that a right of indemnity—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has arisen under this Part, offer an indemnity to the person of such value which, in the opinion of the Registrar, satisfies the right;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has not arisen under this Part, refuse the application.

subsection.leadIn: The Court shall, on application made to it by an interested person who has made an application under subsection (1) and who has rejected an offer mentioned in subsection (1)(b)(i) or who has had the application refused under subsection (1)(b)(ii)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine whether a right of indemnity has arisen under this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it determines that a right of indemnity has arisen under this Part, determine the amount of the indemnity in accordance with section 85 and award the indemnity accordingly together with, as to the Court appears just, any costs and expenses properly incurred in relation to the matter.

subsection.content: No proceedings may be commenced in the Court for the purposes of determining whether a right of indemnity has arisen under this Part except by a person mentioned in subsection (2).
A person who has accepted an offer under subsection (1)(b)(i) shall not commence any proceedings in the Court under Part 11 or this Part.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Time limit for claiming indemnity
section.text: A liability to pay an indemnity under this Part shall be deemed to be a simple contract debt and, for the purposes of section 4 of the Limitation Ordinance (Cap. 347), the cause of action shall be deemed to arise at the time when the claimant knows or, but for his own default, might have known, of the existence of his claim.

subsection.content: Where an indemnity is paid for a loss, the Government shall be entitled to recover the amount paid from any persons who have caused or substantially contributed to the loss by their fraud, in proportion to their respective contributions to the loss.

The Government shall be entitled to enforce any express or implied covenant or other right which the person who is indemnified would have been entitled to enforce in relation to the matter in respect of which indemnity has been paid.

For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that subsections (1) and (2) shall not operate to prevent a person to whom an indemnity has been paid from taking any legal proceedings or enforcing any right to recover any amount of damages that, by virtue of the operation of section 85(1)(a), he has not been able to recover from the Land Titles Indemnity Fund.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Discrepancy in area and boundary
section.leadIn: As between the Government and the owner of registered land, no claim to indemnity under this Part shall arise, and no legal proceedings in respect thereof shall be commenced or maintained, on account of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any surplus or deficiency in the area or measurement of the land disclosed by a survey (whether or not by an authorized land surveyor referred to in section 44) showing an area or measurement differing from the area or measurement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: disclosed on any subsequent survey of the land; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: shown in the Title Register, on any Government lease or on any plan, or on any microfilm, image record or other record of any plan, kept in the Land Registry under section 6;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any boundary of the land disclosed by a survey (whether or not by an authorized land surveyor referred to in section 44) showing a boundary differing from any boundary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: disclosed on any subsequent survey of the land; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: shown in the Title Register, on any Government lease or on any plan, or on any microfilm, image record or other record of any plan, kept in the Land Registry under section 6; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any discrepancy in the area or measurement of the boundaries, whether upon a survey or otherwise, arising from the application or the determination of the boundaries of the lot under section 94.

subsection.content: An indemnity fund, to be known as the Land Titles Indemnity Fund, shall be established for the purposes of this Part in accordance with the regulations.
The amount of any indemnity awarded under section 86(1) or (2)(b) shall be paid out of the Land Titles Indemnity Fund.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Appeals against decisions made by Registrar

subsection.leadIn: A person aggrieved by a decision made by the Registrar under this Ordinance (except a decision relating to a claim for indemnity) may appeal to the Court against the decision by serving on the Registrar a notice of appeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: not later than 30 days after the decision has been made or such further period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as the Registrar permits in any particular case; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as to the Court appears just in any particular case.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Registrar receives a notice of appeal under subsection (1), he shall prepare and send a brief statement of the question in issue to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appellant; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person appearing to the Registrar from the Title Register to be affected by the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: On the hearing of an appeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appellant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person who, in the opinion of the Court, is affected by the appeal,

subsection.continued: may, subject to any rules of court, appear and be heard in person or by a counsel.

subsection.content: The Court may make such order on an appeal as the circumstances may require together with, as to the Court appears just, any costs and expenses properly incurred in relation to the appeal.
The Registrar shall give effect to an order made under subsection (4), in so far as it relates to him, in accordance with the provisions of the order.

subsection.def: In subsection (1), “decision” (決定) includes a direction, order, requirement, determination and refusal.

section.name: s92
section.heading: Effect of appeal on disposition
section.leadIn: An appeal under section 91 shall not affect a disposition—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in good faith and for valuable consideration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: registered at any time before the notice of appeal under section 91(1) is made the subject of a non-consent caution.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Appeal rules, etc.
section.text: The Chief Justice may make rules for regulating appeals under section 91, and applications made under this Ordinance to the Court, and for the fees to be paid in respect of such appeals and applications.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the terms and conditions of the Government lease concerned and to subsection (2), the owner of registered land may make an application in the specified form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the Director of Lands; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a determination of the boundaries of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the lot; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a portion of the lot after the rest of the lot has been surrendered to or resumed by the Government.

subsection.leadIn: The Director of Lands shall not make a determination under subsection (1) in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any subdivision of a lot which is made by a person other than the Government; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a case where the application concerned does not have the consent of all the owners of the lot.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), the Director of Lands shall make a determination of the boundaries of a lot which is the subject of an application under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by causing searches to be done to ascertain whether a land boundary plan prepared by the Director of Lands already exists (“existing plan”);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is an existing plan, by deciding whether or not the existing plan is acceptable for the determination of the boundaries of the lot;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the Director of Lands decides that the existing plan is so acceptable, then, with the consent of the owner of the lot and upon payment of the relevant fee, by causing the existing plan to be registered;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if there is no existing plan or the existing plan is not acceptable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by advising the owner of the lot to appoint an authorized land surveyor to conduct a land boundary survey of the lot in accordance with the code of practice approved under the Land Survey Ordinance (Cap. 473) and to deliver the resultant land boundary plan (“new plan”) certified by the authorized land surveyor and accompanied by the relevant fee to the Director of Lands; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the Director of Lands decides to do so and with the consent of the owner of the lot and upon payment of the relevant fee, by conducting a land boundary survey of the lot and preparing the resultant land boundary plan (“new plan”);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by deciding whether or not the new plan, if any, is acceptable;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: if the Director of Lands decides that the new plan is so acceptable and with the consent of the owner of the lot and upon payment of the relevant fee, by causing the new plan to be registered.

subsection.leadIn: The Director of Lands shall not make a determination of the boundaries of a lot under this section if the existing plan or new plan changes the boundaries or area or measurement of that lot as shown—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on a land boundary plan, or a microfilm, image record or other record of a land boundary plan, kept in the Land Registry under section 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on any Government lease.

subsection.content: The Director of Lands may authorize in writing a person to perform any function or exercise any power imposed or conferred on the Director under this section.

subsection.def: In this section, “determination” (釐定), in relation to a boundary, means adding the bearings, boundary dimensions and coordinates wherever applicable in the process of updating the boundary.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Address for service
section.leadIn: The Registrar may, by notice in writing served on a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: presents an application for the registration of any matter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is the owner of registered land or a registered charge, or the lessee of a registered long term lease,

section.continued: require the person to provide to the Registrar a notice in writing—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specifying an address in Hong Kong for service on that person; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: within the period specified in the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: Where under this Ordinance a thing is to be or may be done after giving a person an opportunity of being heard, that person shall be deemed to have been given such an opportunity if he—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: attends before the Registrar personally or by a solicitor or other agent, and is given such an opportunity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: intimates, personally or by a solicitor or other agent, that he does not wish to be heard; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has been served with a notice in writing specifying the nature of the thing to be done and appointing a day and time not less than 12 working days after service of the notice at which he will, if he attends before the Registrar, be heard.

subsection.content: Where a person or a solicitor or other agent on his behalf attends before the Registrar concerning a matter on which he is entitled to an opportunity of being heard, or fails to attend pursuant to a notice referred to in subsection (1)(c), the Registrar may, if he thinks fit, adjourn the hearing from time to time, and, notwithstanding failure to attend, may, if he thinks fit, hear such person at any time.

Where under this Ordinance all persons interested or affected are to be given an opportunity of being heard, it shall be sufficient if all persons who, according to any current entry in the Title Register, appear to be so interested or affected, are given such an opportunity.

subsection.def: In this section, “working day” (工作日) means any day other than a public holiday or a black rainstorm warning day or gale warning day within the meaning of section 71 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s97
section.heading: Application to Court by person other than Registrar

subsection.leadIn: A person interested in registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease may apply by originating summons to the Court in respect of any question relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the title to the land, charge or lease; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an interest in the land, charge or lease where the interest is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: registered or registrable; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: expressed by this Ordinance not to require registration,

subsection.continued: and the Court may make such order on the originating summons and as to costs as to the Court appears just.

subsection.content: No proceedings may be commenced under this section in respect of any matter for which proceedings may be commenced under section 82.
The Registrar shall give effect to an order made under subsection (1) in accordance with the provisions of the order.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 14 years if he fraudulently—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issues or makes, or causes the issue or making of, any application for the registration of any matter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: presents, or causes the presentation, to the Registrar of any application for the registration of any matter;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: makes, or causes the making of, any erasure or alteration to any application for the registration of any matter;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: verifies any application required by section 14(2) to be verified;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: makes, or causes the making of, any erasure or alteration to any microfilm, image record or other record of any application for the registration of any matter;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: procures the issue of a title certificate;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: makes, or causes the making of, any erasure or alteration to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Title Register;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the applications register;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any document, or any microfilm, image record or other record of a document, kept in the Land Registry under section 6;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any endorsement on any thing referred to in subparagraph (i), (ii) or (iii); or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any copy, print or extract of or from any thing referred to in subparagraph (i), (ii) or (iii) or of or from any endorsement on any such thing; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: removes, or causes the removal, from the Land Registry of all or any part of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any thing referred to in paragraph (g)(i), (ii) or (iii);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any endorsement on any such thing;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any copy, print or extract of or from any such thing or of or from any endorsement on any such thing.

subsection.content: Any person who, without lawful authority or reasonable excuse, does any act referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g) or (h) of subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who knowingly misleads or deceives any person referred to in section 11(3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when that second-mentioned person is acting in the capacity referred to in that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an interest in registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: Any person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with any requirement made under section 8(2)(a), (b) or (c) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $500.

Any person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement made under section 34(1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $1,250.

Any person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement made under section 95 within the period specified in the requirement commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $500.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: “alteration” (更改) includes making an entry;
“application for the registration of any matter” (要求將任何事項註冊的申請) includes any document accompanying the application;
“daily penalty” (每日罰款) means a penalty for each day on which the offence concerned is continued;
“erasure” (塗抹) includes defacement, obliteration and mutilation.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Power of Registrar to specify forms

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the Registrar may specify the form of any document required under this Ordinance to be in the specified form and the form of such other documents (including conveyancing documents) required for the purposes of this Ordinance as he thinks fit.

The Registrar’s power under subsection (1) shall be subject to any express requirement under this Ordinance for a form, whether specified or otherwise, to comply with that requirement, but that requirement shall not restrict the exercise of that power in respect of that form to the extent that, in the opinion of the Registrar, his exercise of that power in respect of that form does not contravene that requirement.

Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (2), the Registrar shall not specify under subsection (1) the form of any conveyancing document unless he has first consulted the Collector of Stamp Revenue appointed under section 3 of the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117).

subsection.leadIn: A form specified under this section shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: completed in accordance with such directions and instructions as are specified in the form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by such documents (including instruments, certificates, duplicates of the form and statutory declarations) as are specified in the form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the completed form is required to be provided to the Registrar or any other person, so provided in the manner, if any, specified in the form.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the Registrar’s power under subsection (1) may be exercised in such a way as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: include in the specified form of any document referred to in that subsection a statutory declaration—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be made by the person completing the form; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as to whether the particulars contained in the form are true and correct to the best of that person’s knowledge and belief;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify 2 or more forms of any document referred to in that subsection, whether as alternatives, or to provide for particular circumstances or particular cases, as the Registrar thinks fit;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require, to the extent practicable, the person completing the form to identify any entries in the Title Register to which the form relates which have ceased to have effect; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where registered land or a registered long term lease is the subject of a deed of mutual covenant, within the meaning of section 53, and is also the subject of a registered deed of mutual covenant within the meaning of that section, require an application for the registration of that first-mentioned deed to be accompanied by an application for the removal from the Title Register of the entry referring to that second-mentioned deed.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Regulations relating to fees and levies

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may by regulation prescribe the fees to be paid to the Registrar in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any application for the registration of any matter (whether made pursuant to this Ordinance or any other enactment);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any verification under section 14(2) of any application for the registration of any matter;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: receiving for registration any matter withheld from registration;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the registration of any matter (whether pursuant to this Ordinance or any other enactment);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the deposit or filing of any matter;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any application for satisfaction of a registered charge;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any application for the making, removal or variation of a restriction;

paragraph.name: h
