paragraph.content: the provision (including inspection) of any thing (including any information) required to be or which may be kept in the Land Registry (whether under section 4, 5 or 6 or otherwise), or of a copy, print or extract of or from any such thing or of or from a microfilm, image record or other record of any such thing;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the official signature of any person referred to in section 11(3) to any document, whether such signature is requested or required under the provisions of this Ordinance or any other enactment or otherwise;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the issuance, cancellation or replacement of a title certificate or any other service or facility relating thereto;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the provision of any other service or facility connected with registration or any other matter to which this Ordinance relates.

subsection.content: The amount of any fee prescribed in regulations made under subsection (1) shall not be limited by reference to the amount of administrative or other costs incurred or likely to be incurred in relation to providing the service, facility or matter to which such fee relates and different fees may be so prescribed for the same service, facility or matter in order to provide for particular circumstances or particular cases specified in the regulations.
The Financial Secretary may by regulation prescribe the levies to be paid to the Registrar in respect of the registration of any matter (whether pursuant to this Ordinance or any other enactment).

Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (3), the Financial Secretary may, in exercising his power under that subsection, take account of the indemnification required to be provided by the Government under section 84(1).

The Registrar may act notwithstanding that a prescribed fee or levy or part of a prescribed fee or levy has not been paid, but the Registrar shall make an entry in the Title Register recording the fact that the fee or levy or part of the fee or levy has not been paid.
The Registrar may refuse to register a disposition of registered land, a registered charge or a registered long term lease in respect of which fees or levies are unpaid.

Unpaid fees, levies, costs, charges or expenses required to be paid to the Registrar shall constitute a debt due to the Government and shall be recoverable summarily as a civil debt within the meaning of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227).

Unpaid costs, charges or expenses the subject of an order under section 8(2)(f) which are required to be paid to a person other than the Registrar shall constitute a debt due to that person and shall be recoverable summarily as a civil debt within the meaning of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227).

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may make regulations for all or any of the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the manner of verification of an application for the registration of any matter;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the size, form and colouring of plans attached to or endorsed on an instrument accompanying an application for registration of any matter;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the size and form of, and the particulars to be contained in, instruments accompanying applications for registration of any matter;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: the numbering of applications for the registration of any matter;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the particulars to be entered in the Title Register and the applications register;

paragraph.name: h
i
paragraph.content: the circumstances and the procedures for rectification of the Title Register;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the scrutiny of applications for the registration of any matter;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the procedure to be followed in order to effect the registration of any matter;

paragraph.name: l
m
paragraph.content: the circumstances in which an application for the registration of any matter, which is accompanied by an instrument which is stamped under section 13(2) of the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117), shall be required to be accompanied by an application for the registration of a charge in respect of any stamp duty payable or to be payable on the instrument (including any stamp duty and penalty payable under section 13(7)(b), or additional stamp duty payable under section 13(10), of that Ordinance on that instrument);

paragraph.name: n
o
paragraph.content: without prejudice to the generality of the grounds mentioned in paragraph (n), the circumstances in which the Registrar shall under section 19(2) refuse to proceed with the registration of any matter relating to an undivided share with an exclusive right to use and occupy a part of a building;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: the documents to be provided by a vendor under section 46(1)(a)(iv);

paragraph.name: q
r
s
paragraph.content: the date on which the first registration of any matter, which is not expressly provided for in this Ordinance, shall take effect;

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.content: the notice to be given where the registration of any matter is effected or an application for the registration of any matter is rejected;

paragraph.name: u
paragraph.content: prescribing the use of conveyancing forms in transactions;

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: the power to refuse to enter improper instruments or forms;

paragraph.name: w
paragraph.content: the manner of registration of a long term lease;

paragraph.name: x
paragraph.content: the manner of registration, withdrawal or removal of a consent caution or non-consent caution and the form of consent under a consent caution;

paragraph.name: y
paragraph.content: the manner of registration or removal of a charging order, judgment or order;

paragraph.name: z
paragraph.content: the manner of registration or removal of an inhibition;

paragraph.name: za
zb
zc
paragraph.content: the circumstances in which a title certificate need not be returned for cancellation under section 29(5);

paragraph.name: zd
paragraph.content: the procedure for filing an incorporated document and the effect of the filing;

paragraph.name: ze
paragraph.content: the manner of giving notice by the Registrar;
the safekeeping of any thing referred to in section 4, 5 or 6;

paragraph.name: zg
zh
zi
paragraph.content: regulating the conduct of persons in the Land Registry;

paragraph.name: zj
paragraph.content: enabling any person to be refused entry to the Land Registry and the removal from the Land Registry of any person;

paragraph.name: zk
zl
zm
zn
paragraph.leadIn: the power of the Registrar—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to borrow moneys for the purposes of the Land Titles Indemnity Fund; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to manage and invest the moneys of the Land Titles Indemnity Fund;

paragraph.name: zo
paragraph.content: payments into and out of the Land Titles Indemnity Fund;

paragraph.name: zp
zq
paragraph.content: the procedures for instituting court proceedings for claiming indemnity;

paragraph.name: zr
paragraph.content: prescribing anything that is required or permitted to be prescribed under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: zs
paragraph.content: providing for the better carrying into effect of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: zt
paragraph.content: providing for such incidental, consequential, evidential, transitional, savings and supplemental provisions as are necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving full effect to this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Any regulations made under subsection (1)(zg) or (zh) may specify that a thing referred to in that subsection may be made available or provided, as the case may be, in such form and by such method as the Registrar thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: Any regulations made under this section may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: empower the Secretary to grant exemptions from the regulations, either generally or in a particular case;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for a particular case or class of case;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be made so as to apply only in such circumstances as are prescribed by the regulations.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), any regulations made under this section may include regulations which provide for transitional or savings provisions in respect of any of the enactments repealed or amended by this Ordinance.

Any regulations made under this section may prescribe offences in respect of contraventions of the regulations, and may provide for the imposition in respect of any such offence of a fine at level 3 and of imprisonment for a period not exceeding 2 years.
The Secretary may, with the approval of the Legislative Council, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1.
The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 2.
The enactments specified in Schedule 3 are amended as set out in that Schedule.
The Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128) is amended as set out in Schedule 4.
The Secretary may, with the approval of the Legislative Council, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 3 or 4.

heading.inline: Provisions for Conversion of LRO Land and Long Term Leases from Land Registration System to Land Title System

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: “caution against conversion” (抗轉換警告書) has the meaning assigned to it by section 1A(1) of the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128);

def.name: LROLand
def.leadIn: “LRO land” (《土註條例》土地) means land—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is the subject of a Government lease for which a register has been kept under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which is not registered land within the meaning of section 2(1) of this Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: When LRO land becomes registered land

subsection.content: (1) Subject to the provisions of this section, on the commencement of the 12th anniversary of the appointed day, all LRO land shall be deemed to be registered land, and all the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply to the land accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: (2) Subject to subsection (3), subsection (1) shall not apply to any LRO land—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of which an instrument has been delivered for registration under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128) but has not been registered under that Ordinance before the commencement of the 12th anniversary of the appointed day; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which is subject to a caution against conversion which is registered under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128).

subsection.leadIn: (3) LRO land referred to in subsection (2) shall be deemed to be registered land on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the instrument referred to in subsection (2)(a) is registered under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the land ceases to be subject to a caution against conversion which is registered under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128),

subsection.continued: whichever is the later, and all the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply to the land accordingly.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Date of first registration
section.leadIn: The date of first registration of LRO land shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of land which falls within section 2(1), the 12th anniversary of the appointed day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of land which falls within section 2(2), the date determined under section 2(3).

subsection.content: (1) On the date of first registration of LRO land, there shall vest in the owner of the land the same legal estate or equitable interest and rights as would have been vested in him if the land had been transferred to him and he had been registered as the owner of land under section 25 of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: (2) Subject to subsection (3), the deeming of LRO land to be registered land under section 2 shall not affect the validity or enforceability of any interest—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: existing immediately before the date of first registration of the LRO land;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: affecting the LRO land;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which was not registered under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128) (and whether or not it was capable of registration under that Ordinance); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: which was, immediately before the date of first registration, enforceable against the LRO land.

subsection.content: (3) An interest mentioned in subsection (2) in relation to LRO land deemed to be registered land shall not be enforceable against the land after the sale of the land to a purchaser for valuable consideration after the date of first registration of the land under this Ordinance.

section.name: s5
section.heading:
When long term lease becomes registered
long term lease
section.content: Where, on the date of first registration of any LRO land, the land is subject to a long term lease registered under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128), then on that date the long term lease shall be deemed to be a registered long term lease, and all the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply to the lease accordingly.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Date of first registration
section.content: The date of first registration of a long term lease is the date on which the lease was deemed to be a registered long term lease under section 5.

subsection.content: (1) On the date of first registration of a long term lease, there shall vest in the lessee of the lease the same interest and rights as would have been vested in him if he had been registered as the lessee of the lease under section 26 of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: (2) Subject to subsection (3), the deeming of a long term lease to be a registered long term lease under section 5 shall not affect the validity or enforceability of any interest—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: existing immediately before the date of first registration of the long term lease under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: affecting the land;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which was not registered under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128) (and whether or not it was capable of registration under that Ordinance); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: which was, immediately before the date of first registration of the long term lease under this Ordinance, enforceable against the land.

subsection.content: (3) An interest mentioned in subsection (2) in relation to land shall not be enforceable against the land after the sale of the land to a purchaser for valuable consideration after the date of first registration of the long term lease under this Ordinance.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Registers kept under Land Registration Ordinance
section.content: On the date of first registration of LRO land for which a register has been kept under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128), the register shall, subject to the regulations, be deemed to form part of the Title Register, and all the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply to the register accordingly.

section.name: s9
section.heading:
Transitional provisions in respect
of Title Register, etc.
section.leadIn: Subject to the regulations, where a register has been kept under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128) in relation to LRO land, then, on and after the date of first registration of the land under section 3, the priority of all interests in the Title Register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: existing immediately before the date of first registration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of which a memorial of an instrument within the meaning of the Land Registration Regulations (Cap. 128 sub. leg. A) has been registered under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128),

section.continued: shall be determined in accordance with the provisions of the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128), and the provisions of this Ordinance shall be construed accordingly.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Transitional provision in respect of registered caveat
section.leadIn: Where immediately before the date of first registration of LRO land under this Ordinance there was a caveat registered against the land under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128), then, commencing on the date of first registration of the land under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the caveat shall be deemed to be a non-consent caution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notwithstanding section 35(1) of this Ordinance, the priority of the interest claimed in the deemed non-consent caution shall be determined in accordance with the law in force immediately before the date of first registration of the land concerned and applicable to the priority among such interests; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all the provisions of this Ordinance (including sections 73 and 74) shall apply to the deemed non-consent caution accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Where an instrument—

section.name: s146
section.heading: Section added
section.leadIn: The following is added—

section.heading:
Land boundary plans for
subdivision of registered land

subsection.leadIn: (1) Subject to subsections (2) and (3), where there is presented to the Land Registrar any application—

paragraph.content: within the meaning of the Land Titles Ordinance (Cap. 585); and
the registration of which under that Ordinance will effect a division of registered land,

subsection.continued: then the instrument accompanying the application and providing for the division shall, in respect of each of the parcels of land to result from the division, be accompanied by a land boundary plan—

paragraph.content: showing and delineating those parcels; and
subject to subsection (4), signed and certified by an authorized land surveyor in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: (2) Without prejudice to the generality of subsections (3) and (4)—

paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), it shall not be necessary for an instrument referred to in subsection (1) to be accompanied by a land boundary plan referred to in subsection (1) where the division of registered land concerned is provided for by a will or judgment and that instrument is the grant of probate in respect of the will, or the judgment, as the case may be;

it shall be necessary for an instrument accompanying an application presented for the registration under the Land Titles Ordinance (Cap. 585) of a dealing to effect the passing of title to any parcel of land resulting from that division to be accompanied by such a land boundary plan.

subsection.content: (3) It shall not be necessary for an instrument referred to in subsection (1) or (2)(b) to be accompanied by a land boundary plan referred to in that subsection if the instrument was executed before the commencement of section 30.

subsection.leadIn: (4) It shall not be necessary for a land boundary plan—

paragraph.content: accompanying an instrument referred to in subsection (1) or (2)(b); and
which has been prepared by the Government,

subsection.continued: to be signed and certified by an authorized land surveyor.

subsection.content: (5) An authorized land surveyor who certified a land boundary plan referred to in subsection (1) or (2)(b) shall deposit with the Authority a duplicate of the land boundary plan and the survey record plan of the relevant land boundary survey both signed and certified in the specified form, not later than 7 days after the application referred to in that subsection to which the land boundary plan relates was presented to the Land Registrar.
(6) A prescribed fee shall be payable to the Authority by the authorized land surveyor who deposits a duplicate land boundary plan and a survey record plan.

subsection.leadIn: (7) The Authority may by notice in writing require any authorized land surveyor who has undertaken a land boundary survey or any part of such survey to deliver to the Authority for his inspection within such time as may be specified in the notice the following documents or things used in connection with or produced from the survey as may be specified in the notice—

paragraph.content: the report of calibration of survey instruments;
the survey instruments;
field notes; and
the report in relation to the land boundary definition.

subsection.content: (8) The Authority shall return any document or thing delivered under subsection (7) as soon as it is practicable after inspection.

(9) The Authority may by notice in writing require an authorized land surveyor who deposited with the Authority under subsection (5) a duplicate land boundary plan and a survey record plan to amend the duplicate land boundary plan or the survey record plan or both so deposited with respect to the new boundary line created by a division of land and shown and delineated thereon in such manner as specified in the notice to make them comply with any code of practice approved under the Land Survey Ordinance (Cap. 473) within such time as specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: (10) For the purposes of this section—
subsection.def: “judgment” (判決) includes a judgment or order of the Court of First Instance, the District Court or the Lands Tribunal;
“registered land” (註冊土地) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Land Titles Ordinance (Cap. 585).

subsection.content: (11) For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that a land boundary plan referred to in subsection (1) shall not have effect other than the effect it has by virtue of its being a plan attached to or endorsed on or accompanying an instrument delivered into the Land Registry for registration under the Land Titles Ordinance (Cap. 585).
(12) This section shall apply to land which is registered land within the meaning of the Land Titles Ordinance (Cap. 585).”.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Sections added
section.leadIn: The following are added immediately after section 21—

section.heading:
Registration of caveat to protect
unregistrable interest
section.content: A person who claims an unregistrable interest in land may make an application in the specified form to the Land Registrar to register a caveat against the land.

subsection.content: (1) The registration of a caveat against land shall constitute notice of the claim which is the subject of the caveat to all persons.

subsection.leadIn: (2) For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the registration of a caveat shall not—

paragraph.content: of itself affect the validity or otherwise of the claim which is the subject of the caveat;
without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (a), constitute a warranty, or a guarantee, as to the validity of the claim.

subsection.content: (3) The registration of a caveat does not prejudice the priority of the claim which is the subject of the caveat.

section.heading:
Relationship between caveat and
registered instrument
section.content: The question of whether a registered instrument is subject to an unregistrable interest claimed under a caveat shall be determined in accordance with the law in force at the time when the transaction which is the subject of the registered instrument was effected.

section.heading:
Priority among unregistrable interests
relating to the same land
section.content: The priority of all unregistrable interests relating to the same land, and whether or not any such interest is the subject of a registered caveat, shall be determined in accordance with the law applicable to the priority among such interests.

subsection.content: (1) A caveat may be withdrawn on the presentation to the Land Registrar by the caveator of an application in the specified form for the withdrawal of the caveat.

subsection.leadIn: (2) A caveat may be removed on the presentation to the Land Registrar of an application in the specified form for the removal of the caveat—

paragraph.content: in any case, by a person who has obtained an order of the Court of First Instance for its removal;

paragraph.leadIn: by the owner of the land affected by the caveat but only if the Land Registrar—

subparagraph.content: is satisfied that the owner has provided a copy of the application to the caveator not less than 14 days before the presentation of the application to the Land Registrar; and
that the caveat was wrongfully registered;
that the ground on which the caveat was registered no longer exists; or
that the caveator consents to the removal of the caveat.

subsection.content: (3) The Land Registrar may require the owner of land presenting an application for the removal of a caveat under subsection (2)(b) to support the application by such evidence as the Land Registrar requires.

(4) A person with an interest in land affected by the caveat may apply by originating summons to the Court of First Instance for the removal of the caveat and the Court of First Instance may make such order on the originating summons and as to costs as to the Court of First Instance appears just.

subsection.leadIn: (5) On the withdrawal or removal of a caveat—

paragraph.content: the Land Registrar shall cause an entry to be made in the register kept under this Ordinance in respect of the land against which the caveat was registered, giving notice of the withdrawal or removal of the caveat; and
any liability of the caveator previously incurred under section 21F shall not be affected by the entry made under paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: (1) A person who applies to the Land Registrar to register a caveat without reasonable cause shall be liable, in an action for damages at the suit of—

paragraph.content: the owner of land concerned; or
any other person who has an interest in the land,

subsection.continued: to pay compensation to the owner or other person for any damage sustained thereby, in such amount as to the Court of First Instance appears just.

subsection.content: (2) A caveator under a registered caveat who fails, without reasonable excuse, to apply to the Land Registrar for the withdrawal of the caveat within a reasonable period of time after the ground on which it was registered ceases to exist, shall be liable, in an action for damages at the suit of a person referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b), to pay compensation to that person for any damage sustained thereby, in such amount as to the Court of First Instance appears just.

(1) Subject to subsection (2), a person who claims to have any title to land, or a beneficial interest in any land, may make an application in the specified form to the Land Registrar to register a caution against conversion against the land.
(2) No application may be made under subsection (1) on or after the 12th anniversary of the appointed day as defined by section 2(1) of the Land Titles Ordinance (Cap. 585).

section.heading: Effect of registration of caution against conversion

subsection.content: (1) Land against which a registered caution against conversion subsists shall not become registered land under the Land Titles Ordinance (Cap. 585).
(2) The registration of a caution against conversion against land shall constitute notice of the claim which is the subject of the caution against conversion to all persons.

subsection.leadIn: (3) For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the registration of a caution against conversion shall not—

paragraph.content: without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (a), constitute a warranty, or a guarantee, as to the validity of the claim.

subsection.content: (4) The registration of a caution against conversion does not prejudice the priority of the claim which is the subject of the caution against conversion.

section.heading:
Relationship between caution against
conversion and registered instrument
section.content: The question of whether a registered instrument is subject to an interest claimed under a caution against conversion shall be determined in accordance with the law in force at the time when the transaction which is the subject of the registered instrument was effected.

section.heading: Validity of registration of caution against conversion

subsection.content: (1) Subject to subsections (2), (3), (4), (5) and (6) and section 21K, the registration of a caution against conversion shall expire immediately upon the commencement of the 1st anniversary of its date of registration.

(2) Subject to subsection (3), the cautioner under a registered caution against conversion may from time to time apply by originating summons to the Court of First Instance for the extension of the validity of registration of the caution against conversion and the Court of First Instance may make such order on the originating summons and as to costs as to the Court of First Instance appears just.

subsection.leadIn: (3) An application for time extension under subsection (2) must be made—

paragraph.content: before the expiration of the validity of registration of a registered caution against conversion; or
if the application is made within an extension granted under that subsection, before the expiration of such extension.

subsection.content: (4) Subject to subsection (5), the Court of First Instance shall not grant any extension of time under subsection (2) which would extend the validity of the registration of a caution against conversion beyond the date of the 2nd anniversary of the caution against conversion’s first date of registration.

(5) The Court of First Instance may, if it is satisfied that exceptional circumstances exist, grant an extension of time under subsection (2) notwithstanding that the applicant has not complied with subsection (3) or that the extension would extend the validity of registration of the caution against conversion beyond the date referred to in subsection (4).

(6) Where before the expiration of the validity of the registration of a caution against conversion under this section, a lis pendens relating to the claim which is the subject of the caution against conversion has been registered by the cautioner against land against which the caution against conversion is registered, then, subject to section 21K, the validity of the registration of the caution against conversion shall not expire under this section until the registration of the lis pendens has been vacated or discharged.

subsection.leadIn: (7) The Land Registrar shall not—

paragraph.content: register more than one caution against conversion in respect of the same claim made by the same person; or

paragraph.leadIn: again register a caution against conversion the registration of which—

subparagraph.content: has previously expired; or
has been withdrawn or removed under section 21K.

section.heading:
Withdrawal and removal of
caution against conversion

subsection.content: (1) A caution against conversion may be withdrawn on the presentation to the Land Registrar by the cautioner of an application in the specified form for the withdrawal of the caution.

subsection.leadIn: (2) A caution against conversion may be removed on the presentation to the Land Registrar of an application in the specified form for the removal of the caution—

paragraph.content: in any case, by a person who has obtained an order of the Court of First Instance for its removal;

paragraph.leadIn: by the owner of the land affected by the caution but only if the Land Registrar—

subparagraph.content: is satisfied that the owner has provided a copy of the application to the cautioner not less than 14 days before the presentation of the application to the Land Registrar; and
that the caution was wrongfully registered;
that the ground on which the caution was registered no longer exists; or
that the cautioner consents to the removal of the caution.

subsection.content: (3) The Land Registrar may require the owner of land presenting an application for the removal of a caution against conversion under subsection (2)(b) to support the application by such evidence as the Land Registrar requires.

(4) A person with an interest in land affected by the caution against conversion may apply by originating summons to the Court of First Instance for the removal of the caution against conversion and the Court of First Instance may make such order on the originating summons and as to costs as to the Court of First Instance appears just.

subsection.leadIn: (5) On the withdrawal or removal of a caution against conversion—

paragraph.content: the Land Registrar shall cause an entry to be made in the register kept under this Ordinance in respect of the land against which the caution against conversion was registered, giving notice of the withdrawal or removal of the caution against conversion; and
any liability of the cautioner previously incurred under section 21L shall not be affected by the entry made under paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: (1) A person who applies to the Land Registrar to register a caution against conversion without reasonable cause shall be liable, in an action for damages at the suit of—

paragraph.content: the owner of land concerned; or
any other person who has an interest in the land,

subsection.continued: to pay compensation to the owner or other person for any damage sustained thereby, in such amount as to the Court of First Instance appears just.

subsection.content: (2) A cautioner under a registered caution against conversion who fails, without reasonable excuse, to apply to the Land Registrar for the withdrawal of the caution against conversion within a reasonable period of time after the ground on which it was registered ceases to exist, shall be liable, in an action for damages at the suit of a person referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b), to pay compensation to that person for any damage sustained thereby, in such amount as to the Court of First Instance appears just.”.
